Written by Ricard Ibanez, the game's creator, and illustrated by Jaimer Garcia Mendoza, over 100 pages that make up the supplement will find extensive information on Asturian lands, both historical and legendary, to fill harsh reality of magic and your adventures Aquelarre.

134101.name: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell Essentials
134101.description:
Box Description

The Best-selling spy action series arrives.

Framed by an unknown enemy, operative Sam Fisher must re-examine his past and launch a new quest to clear his name.

- Storyline spans the entire Splinter Cell series.
- Spy vs. spy wireless multiplayer
- All-new, exclusively designed content.

134102.name: The Lord of the Rings: Tactics
134102.description:
The gameplay takes place on a grid. The game's characters move at the same time, rather than manipulating each entity individually.
Another feature of the game is called the Zone of Control. The Zone of Control means that if the player's character is next to his opponent's square on the grid, they must stop and fight. By using the Zone of Control, combined with simultaneous movement, the player can trap an enemy unit.
The player eventually gets to control a handful of heroes who progressively get more powerful. These are combined with a number of warriors. The user may play as the Fellowship or the minions of Sauron.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Lord of the Rings: Tactics", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134103.name: Village Wolves
134103.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

134104.name: Suzuki TT Superbikes
134104.description:
From the back of the box:

"Race the notorious Isle of Man TT mountain circuit, the longest and most dangerous road race in the world at stomach-churning speeds in excess of 200Mph through tree lined roads, village streets and frighteningly blind corners.

Physically punishing and technically demanding, exhilarating and extreme, the ultimate challenge for man and machine!"

VGG remark
Not to be confused with its 2008 successor: Suzuki TT Superbikes: Real Road Racing Championship

134107.name: Ninja Gaiden Sigma Plus
134107.description:
Ninja Gaiden Sigma Plus is a remake of Ninja Gaiden Sigma for the Playstation Vita. Like Ninja Gaiden Black's "Ninja Dog" mode, Sigma Plus features an easier difficulty called "Hero" mode, making it more accessible to casual gamers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja Gaiden Sigma Plus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134108.name: Online Football Manager
134108.description:
Enter the fantastic world of OFM and become league champion.

Fight to claim coveted trophies and show the world who the one true manager is. Lead your team to the top and prove your skills for strategy, finances, and talent spotting. There are tonnes of features available to help you on your way to the top.

Source: The Game Website.

134109.name: SkiFree 2
134109.description:
User Summary

SkiFree2 is a casual game based on the Windows 95 classic SkiFree. You play as the Yeti, eating skiers and skiboarders as they come down the mountain before the hunger bar fills up.

134110.name: Denti
134110.description:
From the package:
Dental care - healthy eating - an educational game

They players roll alternately a die and move their pawns (styled like a tooth) along the track on the board. The first player moving its pawn on the last field wins.
There are some arrows on special fields of the board that move the pawns forward or backwards. That depends on the picture drawn near to it (eating sweets moves you backwards, brushing your teeth moves you forward).

134111.name: Manspel
134111.description:
Manspel is a two player game with fairly simple rules.
Each player starts with 12 pieces (men) arranged in opposite corners of the board. The object is to occupy the corner-field of the opponent with one of your own men. Pawns of the opponent are caught by jumping, like in checkers. Certain fields in the corners in the middle of the board may be jumped, but not occupied, excepting of course the one corner-field that must be conquered.

134112.name: Catch
134112.description:
From the package: The funny animal catchers game

The players are animal catchers trying to catch as many of the animals as possible.
The board is rectangle of 7x10 squares. The catchers and the animal parts (all animals consist of two parts) are cardboard tiles.
Every player moves his catcher and one part of an animal. If a catcher lands on a correctly assembled animal the player can take it.

134113.name: Tartan Noir
134113.description:
From the publisher's website:

There’s been a murder. A body lies dead in a run-down apartment. There are signs of a struggle. Broken furniture litters the floor. Two of the victim’s fingers have been cut off. There’s a human turd on the mantelpiece. Hang on, what? Welcome to the world of Tartan Noir: fiction with a hardboiled, cynical, violent and frequently alcoholic view of crime in modern-day Scotland. There are good guys, there are bad guys but there definitely aren’t any heroes. Tartan Noir is about world-weary anti-heroes, deeply flawed characters with a variety of vices that would not normally be becoming of someone of their narrative stature. And while it is certainly hardboiled, there’s frequently an edge of wackiness that separates Tartan Noir from its American cousin. So pour yourself a dram of single malt and prepare to indulge in a little Tartan Noir.

134114.name: Ring: The Legend of the Nibelungen
134114.description:
From the Game Box

Alberich, the dwarf tyrant Siegmund, half man/half wolf Loge, the arrogant fire spirit the proud walkyrie warrior

You play all of these characters in a spectacular adventure game that lets you live out Richard Wagner's Ring of the Nibelungen, one of the greatest epics of all time.

Brains, brawn and heart: experience for yourself the mental, physical and emotional challenges of the Nibelungen legend.


6 original game universes and 22 characters in 3D.
Full-screen 360° CINvision™ immersion graphics.
1 hour full-screen animation in CINmovie™.
Multiple-path gameplay : Play 4 adventures at once.
Soundtrack of Richard Wagner's spectacular music.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Games Magazine Game of the Year Winner
134115.description: Garden Dice: The Card Expansion mixes up the Garden Dice base game with 46 Action cards (with 23 unique images) and 8 Event cards. At the start of the game, each player receives a hand of three Action cards; a player can play one card per turn, drawing a replacement at the end of the turn. Action cards, as the name suggests, allow a player to perform one special action, while Event cards (which are shuffled into the deck) affect everyone in the game until a new Event card replaces it.
134115.name: Garden Dice: The Card Expansion

134116.description:
From Flying Frog's website:

Trapped and alone in the Radio Station atop Timber Peak, Samantha the DJ has broadcast for help as the Zombies close in. The only thing keeping them at bay is a thin net of arcing electrical wires she has set up surrounding the building, powered by a pair of old generators. Sputtering as their fuel runs low and the lights flicker, it is clearly only a matter of time before the generators give out. Her only hope is that someone will hear the sound of her voice before it's too late.
134116.name: Last Night on Earth 'Darkest Night' Scenario
boardgamefamily: Last Night on Earth Game Engine

134117.name: Battle of the Sexes: Chocolate After Dinner Mint Edition
134117.description:
Objective: To test your knowledge of the opposite sex through a series of gender based questions. The first player ro team to get their token across the board via the fastest route to their opponents start position wins the "I am the superior sex" badge and wins the remaining after dinner mints.

Contents:
24 After Dinner Mints (medals)
1 gameboard, 6 counters (3 male, 3 female)
1 "I am the superior sex" badge
60 game cards: 20x his, 20x hers, 10 female wild cards, 10 male wild cards.

134118.description:
Ticket to Ride in Lithuania. The expansion contains a map of Lithuania, destination ticket cards and a player aid card, which lists the number of points obtained by building routes of different length. The game is played according to Ticket to Ride: Switzerland rules and the destination ticket cards include country to country and city to country cards. The map also contains tunnels, however the designer explains that because Lithuania doesn't have mountains and therefore doesn't need tunnels, they are actually unsurfaced roads.


Ticket to Ride Lietuvoje. Šis papildymas susideda iš Lietuvos žemėlapio, bilietų kortelių ir pagalbos žaidėjams kortelės, kuri nurodo, kiek taškų gauna žaidėjas nutiesęs vienokio ar kitokio ilgio kelią. Žaidimas žaidžiamas pagal Ticket to Ride: Switzerland (Šveicarija) taisykles ir tarp bilietų kortelių yra tokių, kurios yra iš valstybės (Lietuvos kaimynės) į valstybę ir iš miesto į valstybę. Žemėlapyje taip pat yra tuneliai, tačiau kaip pažymi autorius, todėl kad Lietuvoje nėra kalnų ir tunelių nereikia, jie tiesiog gali būti suprantami kaip sudėtingesnio pravažumo ruožai.
134118.name: Lietuva (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)

134119.name: The Magical Land of Yeld (Playtest Edition 1.0)
134119.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the play test edition of the Magical Land of Yeld, the new adventure game from the creators of Classroom Deathmatch and Sea Dracula! We're eager for your feedback and support. get in on the ground floor and help us make a better, stronger game!

The Magical Land of Yeld is a fantasy adventure game for all ages. By that I mean it’s a game that can be enjoyed by both children and adults. I’m trying to tap the feel of classic adventure role-playing video games that I enjoyed as a kid (Final Fantasy 2, Legend of Zelda, Secret of Mana) and young adult oriented adventure anime I enjoy now (Full Metal Alchemist, One Piece, InuYashu). So what you get out of this game, what you get to do, is be a group of kids from our world that discover a magical door that leads to the strange, dark, dangerous land of Yeld. At first you’ll be able to explore Yeld and safely return home. But eventually the door home will
close, and you’ll be trapped! Once you become trapped in Yeld you’ll take Heroic Jobs and set out on an adventure to find hidden temples, defeat the Hunters of Yeld and win the magical keys to unlock the door back to the real world. You know how this works, right? It’s like Final Fantasy + Alice in Wonderland, or The Legend of Zelda mashed up with Narnia.

Players take turns acting as the Game Master, creating adventures based on the other players input and ideas. Calender and map mechanics govern the time character spend in Yeld and where they can travel. The game has a beginning, with clear progression through a middle and an end that players actively work towards.

134120.name: We Can't Find Shakespeare's Head
134120.description:
Author's description

The funeral is in forty minutes. There's going to be a huge procession and a play at the graveside. Everything's in order, except for one thing: you can't find Shakespeare's head.

Who could possibly have taken it? What sort of sick, money-grubbing, fame-seeking lowlife would do such a thing? After all, the only people here are actors, fans, and producers... and the
Queen. You have to find the head before the funeral, or the Queen will take yours.

User summary
Players draw randomly whether they are actor, producer or fan. Everybody draws two accusations and one excuse (they come with the game). Playing time is 40 minutes: You will not find the head, but you'll find out who is the unlucky one who will have to pay for the fact that it is missing.

134121.name: Dark Champions Holdout
134121.description:
User Summary

Hero Games GenCon 2004 Special

Dark Champions Holdout is a free 4-page promotional handout distributed at the Hero Games booth at the GenCon game convention in 2004. The Holdout was intended to support the release of the Dark Champions genre book.

The Holdout features Offensive & Miscellaneous Abilities defined in Hero System terms for use in a Dark Champions campaign.

134122.name: Treasure Chest Set I
134122.description:
User Summary

The Treasure Chest is a generic fantasy accessory. It is a set of twenty cards that show art of various fantasy items (a Wizard's Hat, Robes, a Scythe, etc.) and have blank lines on the reverse. The intention is that the item can be defined in whatever system is being used for the game and then given to the player that possesses it. The cards are the size of typical index cards (3in. x 5 in.) and come in a zip-lock bag.

rpg: The Fair Folk & the Wyrd Sisters: A Tragic Comedy of Love & Death
134123.name: The Fair Folk & the Wyrd Sisters: A Tragic Comedy of Love & Death
134123.description:
The Fair Folk & the Wyrd Sisters: A Tragic Comedy of Love & Death is a "Tabletop LARP for 5-8 Storytellers", written by Good Idea Games, for Gamechef 2011.
Theme: William Shakespeare.
Ingredients: daughter, exile, nature, forsworn

Author's description

“The Fair Folk and the Wyrd Sisters” is a storytelling game of Love and Death in Shakespeare’s narrative style. Celebrating the incredible similarities between these genres, players are put into two teams, competing in a battle of wits to bring a mortal Pawn to their ultimate end.
This game can be considered a Tabletop Live Action Role-Playing Game. Play takes place sitting around a table, but the action happens in real time, and the words said by the Players are the same words said by the Characters.

The fate of a mortal Pawn is contested as a coven of dangerous Witches compete against capricious Faeries to bring the Pawn to a tragic or comedic end. Using powers of inimitable illusion and influence, both parties take control of the very fabric of reality to weave a path for the Pawn to follow. Whether they reach a Bitter or Happy end depends on the choices made by the Pawn, and the world woven by the players.
The game is played out over five acts, wherein Witches and Faeries compete to drive the Pawn to a particular End. During each Act, both sides are asked to manipulate the Pawn into completing a number of goals that help drive them toward one end or another.As the story enters the final act, the group that best accomplished their goals will bring the Pawn to a Bitter End, or a Happily Ever-After.

134124.name: Das Kreuz des Erebus
134124.description:
German translation of the three part campaign The Erebus Cross in one book.

From back cover:

"Unsere Mission: Die Mysterien der Vergangenheit erforschen, die Relikte der Vorfahren studieren und diese Relikte zum Wohl der ganzen Menschheit schützen und bewahren."

Théah ist groß und gewaltig, und doch ist das, was uns selbst die besten Landkarten zeigen, noch längst nicht alles.
Viele seiner Geheimnisse liegen unter dem Schutt der Jahrtausende verborgen, und es erfordert mutige Frauen und Männer, diese Geheimnisse zu entdecken und uns zu offenbaren. Aus diesem Grund wurde die Forschergesellschaft gegründet, die es sich zum Ziel gesetzt hat, die Rätsel, die uns die Vergangenheit aufgibt, zu lösen. Aber auch andere sind auf der Suche ...

Das Kreuz des Erebus beinhaltet:
- Eine dreiteilige Kampagne, die Ihre Helden in beinahe jeden Winkel Théahs führt und dabei das Schicksal von Nationen und sogar der ganzen Welt in deren Hände legt. Und natürlich gilt es, einigen üblen Schurken das Handwerk zu legen!
- Einen detaillierten Überblick über die Forschergesellschaft, über ihre Geschichte und ihre wichtigsten Mitglieder, sowie über viele Geheimnisse, die unter unseren Füßen verborgen liegen und nur darauf warten, entdeckt zu werden.
- Eine neue Schwertkampfschule, neue Fertigkeiten und neue Ausrüstung.

Google translation

"Our mission: to explore the mysteries of the past, studying the relics of the ancestors and protect these relics for the benefit of all mankind and preserve."

Théah is large and powerful, and yet that's what we show even the best maps, there's more.
Many of its secrets lie hidden in the rubble of thousands of years, and it takes brave men and women to discover these secrets and to reveal to us. For this reason, the researchers company was founded, it has set itself the goal to solve the puzzles that we give up the past. But others are looking ...

The cross of the Erebus includes:
- A three-part campaign that leads your hero in almost every corner Théahs while the fate of nations, and even the whole world in their hands sets. And of course it is important to put some evil villains the craft!
- To be discovered a detailed overview of the research company, about its history and its key members, as well as many secrets that lie hidden beneath our feet and just waiting.
- A new sword fighting school, new skills and new equipment.

134125.name: The Temptress
134125.description:
Author's pitch: A mystery! Court women on the Isle of the sorceress, win the heart of your perfect match, and reveal the disguised sorceress’s identity.

User Summary
Players take on the role of suitors wooing the daughters of a mighty sorceress on her island. They compete to find their perfect match and leave with her. A deck of cards and poker chips are used to represent the women and growing rapport with their suitors.

134126.name: 2300ish: Mankinds Biggest Cockups to Date
134126.description:
User Summary

2300ish is a self-published RPG from the mid-1980s, most probably from 1986 or 1987. To my knowledge this set was never sold; I was handed this copy by the presumptive creator at a game convention in Georgia in the late-1980s. Though positioned as a system for "hard SF roleplaying" in the far future, it is reasonably well-suited for a high-tech modern or near-future game. Also, it is a generic system in that it has no setting material.

It is a full-featured game with character generation, task resolution mechanics, and a well-worked out combat system. It also has conversion information for Phoenix Command which means 2300ish must have been published in or after 1986, the year the first Phoenix Command title was published.

Unfortunately no year of publication or designer information is printed in this title.

134127.name: Ruins of War
134127.description:
From the publisher:

Your tabletop never looked better! With this pack of customizable terrain tiles, you can add a new dimension to your Dungeons & Dragons adventures. Easy to set up and infinitely expandable, this pack allows you to create the adventures you want to play. Pick up additional packs to create larger, more elaborate encounters.

This pack contains six durable, double-sided card stock sheets of illustrated terrain, with die-cut tiles you can use to create battlefields and warzones in your campaign. Use this product and other Dungeon Tiles accessories to make great D&D encounters that enhance your roleplaying game experience.

134128.name: Wargame Gettysburg
134128.description:
User Summary

The battle of Gettysburg was fought over 3 days from July 1st-3rd 1863. It is considered the turning point of the American civil war, showing that the Confederates were not invincible, halting the invasion of the North, and providing the political popularity for Lincoln to be re-elected as president.

This wargame allows you to play either side against the computer, or hotseat against another player. There is a map of the Gettysburg battlefield divided into hexagons, each representing about 500 yards across. The combat units are brigades, with each figure representing 100 men or 10 guns.

Victory is achieved by the capture of flagged areas on the map (the flag indicates ownership) and also inflicting more losses.

The game can be played with fog of war on or off, and options can be set for when the tardy Confederate cavalry commander, General Stuart, shows up (although this will also affect his Union cavalry counterparts).

Game copyright Dave Kershaw, DK Simulations Ltd 2012.
Artwork by Gonzalo Santacruz

134129.name: Cultures Online
134129.description:
Cultures Online is a free-to-play browser-based Massively Multiplayer Online Role-Playing Game. After you have registered for the game, you can test your skill against other Vikings and chat with other players in the forum.

Your hero's adventure starts in his or her village way in the icy north on an island somewhere in the vicinity of Iceland. Hire more Vikings and decide whether you want them to help you expand your village or to accompany your hero on raiding expeditions. Bear in mind, though, that only your heroes will be able to make the other Vikings in the village work. You choose how your village should develop. Are you more the warrior type, a builder, or a great researcher? Your decision will influence the opportunities that become available to you.

Source: The Game Website.

134130.name: King of Kings 3
134130.description:
King of Kings 3 is a free-to-play 3D online role-playing game (MMORPG) with an emphasis on PvP and RvR. Discover a medieval fantasy world, splintered into seven unstable enemy realms after many long years of bitter war.
Join one of these realms and create your own destiny. Found a guild with your friends and wage bitter war against other guilds. With your legions by your side, you can create a kingdom of your own. Conquer enemy armies to become the King of Kings!

Source: The Game Website.

134131.name: Golfstar
134131.description:
Golfstar is the next generation online golf game.

Enjoy tournaments with up to 30 players at the same time, get the coolest clothes and meet your friends on the market place to discuss your tactics for the next round. Scale your stat and skill points to hit the perfect shot.


Enjoy tournaments with up to 30 players at the same time
Compete with other players from all over the world
Get the coolest clothes and meet your friends on the market place to discuss the tactics for the next round
Scale your stat points and skill points to hit the perfect stroke
Improve your equipment in several different categories to defeat your opponents and rise to the top of the international rankings
Thorough and entertaining introduction to the game
Join or create a guild and challenge other guilds


Source: The Game Website.

134132.name: The Adventures of Maddog Williams in the Dungeons of Duridian
134132.description:
The Adventures of Maddog Williams in the Dungeons of Duridian was released by Game Crafters in 1992. The game is a cross between a text adventure and a role-playing game whereby the player took the role of Maddog Williams, a shopkeeper from the seaside town of Marinor.

Maddog Williams was released on Amiga, Atari ST and PC and a sequel was planned for release entitled Escape from Cylindria. Currently the game is freely available for download from the developers' website.

Players control the titular Maddog Williams and must guide him through eight quests spread over the game's length. The quest begins in Maddog's home, the player is able to explore before gradually finding clues on how to progress further due to the relatively non-linear nature of the game compared to other adventures. The game's environments house objects to manipulate and non-player characters to converse with for information, as well as enemies who can be vanquished through combat.

Source: The Publisher Website.

134133.name: The Adventures of Robbo
134133.description:
The Adventures of Robbo is a puzzle video game developed by xLand Games and published in 1994 by Epic MegaGames. The game was re-released under Creative Commons in 2006.

The player controls Robbo though a series of mazes. Robbo travels several worlds spanning A through O each with a unique theme collecting bolts. Each world has a unique passcode for it, however the passcode is never the same from one computer or another.

Source: Wikipedia, "Adventures of Robbo", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134134.name: Epic Puzzle Pack
134134.description:
User Summary

The Epic Puzzle Pack includes 3 xLand Games productions originally created in Poland at the turn of the 90s decade.

134135.name: Alive Sharks
134135.description:
User Summary

Alive Sharks is a game of gathering moving valuables underwater while avoiding dangerous sea creatures. The "frogman," or scuba diver, must swim through the underwater to collect rare sea creatures, each worth 10 points. His stun gun can temporarily pacify either the sharks or jellyfish, which move about menacingly under water. Frogman is safe inside the steel cage, but he cannot attain any points this way. A level is complete upon reaching 100 points and Frogman dies after 50 shark bites or 1 jellyfish sting. The stingray level is a tutorial in which Frogman cannot be harmed.

134136.name: Alpha Man
134136.description:
User Summary

In Alpha Man, one pushes boxes about the level, trying to place them exactly in the position that the map requires. Each box has a letter and the letters make up a word. The player does not try to spell the word; rather, the word simply provides the number of boxes and letters intended for the letter.
Boxes with letters on them slide as far as they can in a straight direction if pushed, which adds to the challenge. Boxes without letters can be positioned one square at a time.

134137.name: Adomoc
134137.description:
Adomoc is an abstract strategy board game for two players. Each player has a "breed" of fifteen playing pieces of which there are three types: a foot, a moon, and a sun. The game is played on a circular board with eighty-one spaces arranged in nine concentric cycles. The goal is to move one's prime sun from the outer edge of the board, to the centre.

Adomoc games tend to involve a fair amount of motion. Players may conceptualize strategies that focus on organizing movement as opposed to blocking the opponent's movement. Because both players are aiming for the same goal and can in some situations use an opposing piece to aid a win, the game incorporates a collaborative ebb-and-flow.

Players alternate turns. Each of the three types of playing piece have a particular pattern in which it can move. Feet can move around the cycles or back and forth along columns from cycle-to-cycle. Moons can move in spiral patterns between cycles, and suns can move in any of the directions. The pieces can behave in three different ways. These behaviours are: originating (sending an opponent's or one's own piece back to an origin space), consuming (removing an opponent's piece from play), and attracting (holding a foot in place).

Adomoc was originally invented in 2001 and has evolved such that there are two variants to the official rules. Adomoc rules promote thinking beyond dual polarities. Its design reflects universal symbols that are grounding and expand beyond the concrete immediacy of common human experience. The game's rules and designs are available under both Creative Commons licences and the unique Adomoc Artisan Licence (AAL), which enables other people to produce their own Adomoc sets. Adomoc also has a standard notation, which enables it be played by correspondence.

134138.name: Tomb Raider: The Lost Artefact
videogameexpansion: Tomb Raider III: Adventures of Lara Croft
134138.description:
User Summmary

Tomb Raider: The Lost Artefact follows Core Design's tradition of releasing a "Gold" expansion to each successive Tomb Raider game, often just before or (in this case) just after releasing the newest game in the Tomb Raider franchise.

In The Lost Artefact, Lara Croft, fresh from foiling Dr. Willard's plans for world domination at his antarctic base, follows up a new lead: is there a fifth piece of the meteorite? Her quest takes her from first to Scotland, then to Dover, and finally to Paris, where she must confront a rival she had written off as dead.

134139.name: Bar Hopping
134139.description:
Bar Hopping is a roll-and-move drinking game which instructs players on alternatives to drinking and driving. Players (or teams of players) move their playing pieces (cars) around the board and perform actions on cards that they draw, depending on which space they land on. The first player (or team) to complete the predetermined number of kilometers is the winner.

From the game box:

"You and your friends are out bar hopping, when you suddenly realize that nobody can legally drive. So you all decide that the smartest thing to do would be to take a cab home. Great move, but here is where the twist in the game begins. While riding home in the cab, everyone falls asleep and starts to dream. These dreams turn into the worst nightmares of your life. Believe it or not, you actually start dreaming that you are driving home from the bar. Like most dreams, this one is just as crazy, as you will soon find out. When the dreams begin, so does the game. The only way to wake up and end these horrible nightmares is to win the game by being the first person, or team, to obtain the predetermined amount of kilometers set before starting the game."

134141.name: More Convoluted
134141.description: More Convoluted takes the Convoluted series to the next level; even more ways to win! With new actions like Salvage and Recycle. Don’t have the winning card? Try taking it from the discard pile. Players race to complete words that change so be quick, only one can claim a word! Too late? Try for a different word. Wild cards replace any letter! But too many will hurt your score. In a game where scoring matters. 10 points to win! More Convoluted: social, engaging, fun and fraught.

134142.name: Dynasty Warriors Next
134142.description:
Dynasty Warriors Next (真・三國無双 NEXT Shin Sangoku Musō NEXT?, known in Japan as Shin Sangoku Musou NEXT) is a Beat 'em up video game and a spin-off title of the Dynasty Warriors series of video games. It is exclusively for the PlayStation Vita. Similar to other games in the series, the game's plot follows that of the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms by Luo Guanzhong. The game was developed as a Vita launch title, and was released along with the console in all regions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dynasty Warriors Next", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134143.name: All's Well That Ends As You Like It
rpg: All's Well That Ends As You Like It
134143.description:
User summary

All’s Well That Ends As You Like It is a game submitted to Game Chef 2011: Shakespeare. Players move their pieces on a board, interacting with the locations and each other. The player who achieves her goal (either tragic or comic) first, wins the game.

Pitch: Dueling, wooing, vows kept or forsworn, drunkenness, thievery, costumes, identical twins, rightful rulers, virtuous innocents, ghosts, and much more.

134144.name: Name Your Nightmare
134144.description:
From the back off the book:

Fans of creepy Tales from the Crypt can read their way through eight engrossing plot paths in the Find Your (Unfortunate) Fate adventure. A group of party-hearty teenage campers are forced to face their worst nightmares, from flesh-eating zombies to knife-wielding maniacs, when they disturb the evil spirit of their cabin's previous owner.

134145.name: Puzzle Craft
videogamehonor: 2013 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
134145.description:
Puzzle Craft combines two of your favorite genres for the first time ever! Build your settlement up from humble beginnings like in all great town-building games, while at the same time using simple touch controls to complete tile-matching puzzles!

Source: The Publisher Website.

134146.name: Stig-Helmers sällskapsspel
134146.description: User Summary: Stig-Helmers sällskapsspel is a game with theme from the five swedish movies about Stig-Helmer Olsson. The game is a point to point movement game, but with a twist. With money ("Peseta") you can bribe yourself forward. And there is also cards (Händelsekort/"Filmisar") that can help you or make you overturn. First to the finish with a full itinerary wins.

134147.name: Endless Road
134147.description:
Put your foot down and drive along a unique landscape that builds itself right before your eyes and falls away behind you. Dodge the traffic to keep your speed up and hit chevrons to boost Explore new areas on each run, use power-ups to clear the way, and drive as far as you possibly can!

Source: The Publisher Website.

134149.name: Storm the Train
134149.description:
A one-way ticket to side-scrolling mayhem!

Send three gun-toting agents aboard a locomotive packed with zombies, robots, ninjas and relentless boss battles. Get trigger-happy with an arsenal of upgradable guns, drones and gadgets to complete missions and cause as much carnage as possible to rack up a high score.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Årets Spel Most Innovative Game Nominee
2012 Årets Spel Most Innovative Game Winner
134150.name: Mini Curling Game
134150.description: Compact Curling is a board game version of curling for two players (or for more players if playing in teams). Each player/team has four stones. At one of the edges of the board is a starting zone where players drop their stones, trying to make them glide on the board to the other side where the house is. The goal is to come closest to the center of the house with as many stones as possible.

134151.name: AI War: Ancient Shadows
134151.description:
Not Even The Machine Sees All...

Introducing Champions: These modular behemoths can be upgraded, gain EXP, and lend powerful aid to your main forces. But champions possess a unique power that sets them even further apart from other units: they can explore entirely new parts of the galaxy where the AI cannot reach. Splinter factions of humans, zenith, neinzul, and spire all dwell in those backwater nebulae. Some are hiding. Some are plotting. Some have gone totally insane. It is there, in the shadows, that your champion can find relics from the ancient race which constructed it. What power awaits? At what cost?
Key Features


A whole new kind of human player. It's possible to control champions alongside your main fleet, or to have a friend or family member control just one single massive ship.
Several new sub-races dwelling in the backwater parts of the galaxy for your champions to interact with.
Modular fortresses.
9 new bonus ship classes.
3 core AI guard posts and one new minor faction.
2 new AI types.
2 new map types.
98 minutes of awesome new music by Pablo Vega.


Source: The Publisher Website.

134153.description: The Core Worlds: Galactic Orders Promo Pack consists of 7 cards, including Buono (a new Core World) and reprints of the original 6 Core Worlds with added flavor text. The Promo Pack was available at Spiel 2012 and BGG.CON 2012, as well as with the pre-order for Core Worlds: Galactic Orders.
134153.name: Core Worlds: Galactic Orders Promo Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Boardgame Review Room: Core Worlds

boardgamecompilation: Siberia / Key West / Bangkok Klongs Expansion
134154.description:
Each player gets one dragon boat in his color.

During his move, the player can use his dragon boat in addition to placing a boat. It can only used once during the game, the player gives away his dragon boat after using it. While playing the action dragon boat, the player can move one of his own boats to another free area anywhere on the game plan which need not be connected. The player only has to consider the laying rule that in any one market area only 3 boats can be placed. The move can be made either before or after placing a new boat as usual, also in addition to a movement card.
134154.name: Bangkok Klongs: Dragon Boat expansion

boardgamecompilation: Siberia / Key West / Bangkok Klongs Expansion
134155.description:
Both warehouse tiles will be mixed up together with the investment tiles during the preparation period. A warehouse can be obtained like the other investment tiles during the Investment action.

If a player obtains one of the warehouse tiles, he places it beside his gaming board visible for the other players. After a Resource action, resources can be stored in the warehouse. They can be sold at a later time. Storing resources is voluntary, i.e. a player can choose to sell his resources immediately after the Resource action. But he can also choose to store one or two resources in his warehouse, up to a total capacity of 2 resources (same or different). Resources in the warehouse can be sold later in addition to any other action of the player, either before or after that action. If a player has stored two resources, he decides whether to sell both or only one resource. If he sells both resources, he may sell them at different stock exchanges. Each player can only own one warehouse.
134155.name: Siberia: Warehouse expansion

boardgamecompilation: Siberia / Key West / Bangkok Klongs Expansion
134156.description:
Two Mafiosi cards will be placed on two of the seven Key West decks already assembled. Both decks have to be placed aside, they are used in play rounds 6 and 7. In those rounds, during the bid phase, 7 instead of 6 cards are available. In round 8 again only 6 Key West cards can be used.

The player who obtains a Mafiosi card acts immediately in the following way: He removes a wood disk which indicates the ownership of a hotel, a factory or a plantation and gives it back to the owner. Instead he places one of his own wood disks. This replacement is free of charge.
134156.name: Key West: Mafiosi expansion

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
134157.description:
London: The biggest, most important and richest city in England in the late medieval and early modern periods.

The Guilds played a major role in the lives of London's citizens, controlling the way in which trade, manufacturing and business was conducted in the city. The members of the guilds were rich men, who were appointed to the most influential positions in the community and wielded immense civic power. The chief representative of the Guilds became the Lord Mayor of London, and the leading delegates of the Guilds became his Aldermen. Other members of the Guilds were the burghers of London. The Guilds ran the city and controlled its commerce; each had its own Hall and its own Coat of Arms. Representatives of the Guilds met at the Guildhall to discuss the great issues of the day.

In Guilds of London, you place your liverymen in strategic Guilds, building your power base, so that you can achieve the status of Master in many of them. You also have the opportunity to spread your power into the commercially valuable Ulster or Virginia plantations. Control of each Guild provides victory points and additional actions that you can exploit, so that you can control the future development of the city.
134157.name: Guilds of London
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
13. Devon Dice Guilds, Thrones and Assassins
Episode 120: Terraforming Mars, La Granja and The Hype Machine
Episode 16: The one about Iron Fist and social gaming
Episode 17: The one about terraforming mystics, iconography, cults of the new
Episode 76- The Networks and Origins 2016
Episode 83- Salem and Daedalus Productions Contest
Essen 2013 - Surprised Stare
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 14
Great Designers Series (II) - Tony Boydell
HLG 10: Meer Essen
Perfect Information Podcast Episode 20 - Change
Strange Assembly 200 - SuperHero Girls
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 150
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80

134158.name: Gemblo Mini
134158.description:
Gemblo Mini uses the same gameplay as Gemblo, but on a smaller playing surface and with pieces for only two players.

In Gemblo Mini, players take turns placing pieces onto the game board; each piece placed cannot be adjacent to any other pieces of the same color but rather must be a distance of "1" from another piece of the same color, where 1 is the length of a side of one of the small hexagons. (This distance cannot cross an opponent's piece.)

The game ends once no one can place pieces on the board. Players then count the number of hexagonal units in the pieces they couldn't place, and the player with the lowest score wins.

134159.name: Shake'n Play
134159.description:
From the box:
Shake'n Play is an acoustic memory game and consists of 16 nearly identical shakers arranged on an eight-sided board. The 16 shakers make up eight matching pairs, each pair with a distinct sound. The object of the game is to find the matching pairs by trying the sound of one shaker and another in turns.

134160.name: Kuro (English edition)
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 98 - Breakers, Cthulhu Dark: Confidential, Kuro
134160.description:
Publisher blurb:

Kuro is the core rulebook of a new near-future game setting influenced by unremitting Japanese horror.

The year is 2046, and something dark has returned to Japan. With an international blockade set up around the beleaguered country following the Kuro Incident, there is no escape. In addition to the meteorological side-effects of the Incident, some people have noticed a sharp rise in disturbing, mysterious and supernatural occurrences. The authorities refuse to acknowledge such obvious sensationalist delusions. Do you have the strength to face the nightmares?

From the makers of Qin and Yggdrasill, brought to the English language by the C7 translations team headed up by Andrew Peregrine, Kuro is a 208 page hardcover with black and white interior.

134161.name: Respawn
134161.description:
Respawn is a action packed board game that blends a sci-fi setting with the action of PC shooters and some tactical elements of miniature games into a sizable slug fest.
On each turn, a player gets 3 actions in which to make their moves/attacks, then it's on to the next player. During ones turn, you collect from dozens of items and weapons, blow up your buddy and score points. Be careful though, as the more points you score, the more points you are worth to others.
The game features 6 different characters, 10 unique weapons, and a dozen items and gadgets. Maps can be made differently each game with 4 double sided map sheets, and contains rules and components for multiple game types.

134162.name: Brake & Win
134162.description:
This is a "Mensch Ärgere Dich Nicht" typ of game. It is played with trucks (as pawns) and with the same rules but has one extra rule that gives it an extra twist.
If you land on specific fields you get one extra token (regenerating brake system). These tokens can be spent in future turns to go extra steps.

This game was given out by REXROTH (a Bosch Group member)

134164.name: Tactic Elastic
134164.description:
Attach, strech and above all don't snap !

The wheels indicate which elastic band the player must use, and which pillar it has to go round. The player may only use one hand to position the elastic band, while holding onto the board with the other hand.lf he fails, he receives a penalty point. Once a player has received ten penalty points, he is eliminated. The aim is ta be the last player left in the game!
More you play more it's tight!

134165.name: Attack the Tower
134165.description:
Attack the Tower is a card game inspired by defend the tower videogames. There are a print & play version on the publishers website. Two players duel in a fast paced turn based battle. Each participant chooses an army, and must dispose of their heavy and light infantry, shooters, cavalry, siege weapons and special abilities to defeat the opponent.

There are 2 types of cards: bases and abilities. Bases must be played on a territory. Each player has 3 territories and each territory can have up to 3 bases. Troops are recruited on a base and a base can have up to 2 troops.

On his turn a player must decide to reload or not. If he does both players recruit a troop on each of his bases and draw 2 cards. The player can also attack on his turn. Attacks are always from a territory to another. All troops must participate on an attack.

Each troop has a power that counts both for attack and defense. Bases always have a power of 4. To destroy a base one must destroy all its troops first. The goal is to destroy the opponent's Palace that sits behind his territories and has a power of 10. The Palace can only be attacked if at least one of the territories has no bases on it.

134166.name: Brain Shift
134166.description:
Four steering wheels anchor the Brain Shift game, with one wheel designated for each player. In the center of the game sits the stick shift, surrounded by six color (and numbered) lights: (1) red; (2) green; (3) yellow; (4) blue; (5) orange; and (6) white. During a game, players will shift to each of these lights according to the prescribed pattern.

There are six games in all:
Stick Shift: Brain Shift calls out a player, followed by a color, the player must shift to that color. Additional colors are added and the time to complete the shift decreases until only one player is left.
Memory Shift: Brain Shift calls out a player, plus a sequence of colors. Players must shift to these colors or be eliminated. Players are called in order.
Who Shifts It: Just like Memory Shift except random players are chosen each turn.
Ear Shift: A sound is associated to each light. Brain Shift plays the sounds and players must shift to the appropriate color that is assigned to that sound to stay in the game.
Secret Shift: Brain Shift gives you one color, then you must guess the others in 60 seconds. One player only.
Shift Around: Brain Shift provides a starting sequence. Thereafter, each player adds one color after completing the previous sequence.

134168.name: Aces High II
134168.description:
Aces High (formerly known as Aces High II) is a combat flight simulator and massively multiplayer online game for Microsoft Windows. It was created by HiTech Creations and originally released on May 8, 2000, the game is subscriber based and is constantly updated and upgraded. It features aircraft from both the World War II and World War I eras, as well as smaller numbers of ground vehicles and ships.

While the main focus of Aces High is on World War II aerial combat, there is also a smaller selection of ground vehicles, ships and World War I aircraft. There are over 100 aircraft, vehicles and boats individually modeled in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aces High (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134170.name: Eleminer
134170.description:
User Summary

Fly through space mining ore from asteroids. Keep your disrupter core charged by moving. Collect tractor beam capsules to hold onto the ore while searching out docking stations. Avoid getting hit.

134171.name: Champion
134171.description:
User Summary

You are the smartest warrior in the land, smart enough to wield a bow rather than sword. Take out enemy stick figures as they attempt to reach the left side of the screen, and try to get one of your fellow stick figure warrior to reach the right side. Some upgrades available for purchase, but they reset if you die.

134172.description:
What motivates you, Hero: Fame, Fortune, Friendship, or Forbidden Knowledge?

In Questor, the Warrior wields the Fiery Phoenix Cleaver, seeking only glory for slaying foul dungeon beasts. The Rogue wears the Cloak of the River Spirit, hiding in shadows to hunt priceless treasure and a quick escape. The Mage carries the Mystic Staff of the Winds, exploring with a thirst for knowledge alone. The Healer holds aloft the Sacred Emblem of Gaia, Goddess of Earth and Life, desiring nothing more than to help and inspire the others.

Which fearless adventurer are you? With unique powers and a unique quest and victory condition, only one will triumph in this 15-minute dungeon crawl for 2 to 4 players — unless you play with special cooperative or solo rules, in which case you can win alone or work together to all be victorious!

Roll a die to discover how the dark tunnels develop, explore the labyrinth of a dungeon crawling with monsters, and work (or manipulate the other players to help you with your personal objective) so that you can be the first to complete your individual goal and win.
134172.name: Questor

134174.name: Alba
134174.description:
Simple dice word game, published by Alba, a British radio and television manufacturer. The game comprises of four dice, kept in a leather wallet,

Any number can play. The four dice are thrown by each player in turn and the first player to throw the word 'ALBA', wins and takes the prize or kitty. Those are the rules although the publisher does say that "many variations can be thought up of this popular party game". For instance, a player throwing all four of the same letter can get a second place prize, and so on.

134175.name: Jinx 11
134175.description:
Dice game with elements of Shut the Box.

Each player lines up a set of cards in two rows:
6 7 8 9 10
12 13 14 15 16
First player throws the numbered blocks (i.e. dice) and turns face down the card that corresponds to the sum of the top numbers of the blocks. If he should throw 11 on the first turn he merely misses turning over a card, but at all later turns he must turn up a card he has already turned down if he has any.
Play passes to the right. On the second and all other turns, if a player throws a number that he has already turned over, the first player to the right who still has the number may turn it over and have a turn throwing the blocks.
Play continues to the right, it does not go back to those who lost a turn. If every player has turned over the number that is thrown, it is “dead" and the one who threw it may throw again until he throws a number that he or some other player can use, or until he throws an 11.
If a player throws 11, it is good strategy to turn up a number that is "dead" or one that has three chances to one to be thrown. For example, only 3 and 3 make 6, but 3 and 7, 4 and 6, or 5 and 5 make 10.

The first player to get all the cards turned over is winner and the first player next game. Four to six players recommended.

134176.name: Old MacDonald Farm Game
134176.description:
The game consists of 4 playing boards, 1 spinner and animal dice. The object of the game ia to be the first to fill Old MacDonald’s farm with animals.

Each player is glven a playing board and presses out the animal pieces. The youngest player spins the arrow on the spinner and if it points to Old MacOonald then he/she throws the dice snd fits the appropriate animal into his/her playing board. If the arrow points to the tractor or farm house then the play moves clockwise to tha next player in turn. The first player to collect all hls/hsr animals is the winner.

Young players may play without the spinner and just use the dice, collecting animals either randomly or in the sequence of the song.
Older players may extend the playing tlme of the game by using the spinner and collecting tha animals in the sequence of the song.

This game is similar to the same publisher's game Old MacDonald's Farm Game, but this game uses special dice and a spinner, not just a spinner.

134178.name: Pokemon Diamond and Pearl On a Roll Game
134178.description:
Each player has a board on which there are seven combinations of dice rolls (called patterns in the rules) that have to be collected. The first to do so, wins.

The six dice feature characters; Chimchar, Turtwig and Piplup (appearing twice for each character). The seventh dice is blank but for a Poké Ball symbol on one side.

In a turn, a player starts with all 7 dice. If the Poké Ball turns up, the turn ends without scoring. If it doesn't turn up, the player can keep any number of dice that feature in one of his or her combinations. Then another throw is made. This goes on until a pattern is rolled but should a Poké Ball turn up, the turn ends and nothing is scored.

134179.description:
Description from the publisher:

Britain’s favourite playground game as a board game! Can the Runners make it safely across the playground avoiding the Bulldog? The Teachers can help, but if the Runners get caught it’s “British Bulldog”!

Further details:

One player moves the Runners by rolling a number die and a direction die, whilst the other player moves the Bulldog a number of squares restricted by how many Runners have been caught to date. If all the Runners make it safely across the playground without being caught that player is the winner; if the Bulldog catches all the Runners then that player is the winner. Additional Teacher Squares offer protection for the Runners as the Bulldog cannot enter or pass through these squares.

The game introduces elements of both chess and draughts, and combines luck with strategy making it an easy game to learn but with additional depth for older players.
134179.name: British Bulldog

134180.name: Asphalt 7: Heat
134180.description:
Asphalt 7: Heat is a 2012 racing video game from the Asphalt series, developed and published by Gameloft. It was released on June 21, 2012 for the iOS and marks the first time in the series that a game is the same for both the iPhone and iPad. The game was launched for Android on 29 June.

Asphalt 7's gameplay is very similar to that of previous games in the Asphalt series, with the player given the option of either tilting the device or touching the side of the screen to steer. The game also has a multiplayer mode, both local through Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, and global through an internet connection.

The game features predominately the same tracks as Asphalt 6: Adrenaline, although it adds some new tracks, and tracks from the previous game are missing (Cape Town, Monte Carlo, Hong Kong and Detroit).

Asphalt 7: Heat has a total of 64 cars divided into 7 classes, depending on its respective tier.

Source: Wikipedia, "Asphalt 7: Heat", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134181.name: Disney's Stitch Jam
134181.description:
User Summary

Stitch takes on musical missions to dodge obstacles, slam enemies, and gather collectibles. Includes 10 locations, unlockable costumes/accessories, and unlockable characters such as Angel, Reuben, and Felix.

134182.name: Metal Max 2 ReLOADED
134182.description:
User Summary

Metal Max 2 ReLOADED is a complete remake of the original Metal Max 2.

134183.name: A Clockwork Spiral
134183.description:
A Clockwork Spiral is "a game of questions" by Jason A. Petrasko, written for Game Chef 2011 (using the ingredients Exile, Forsworn, and Nature).

Author's description:
Long ago a council of wise men lifted beyond humanity by the visitors created a new world powered by a sidereal clockworks. Ages have past and things have changed, now they have left and human mind this new world. Trapped outside what is and within what could be, these people struggle everyday.
The stage is set and the roles have been cast, now is the moment to toss the dice and take the gamble!

How will this period of turmoil play out? Will the play complete and the Observers return wonton boredom? Perhaps one of the newcomers will bring a new spark to the clockworks and change it all forever? Play out this game of questions and learn the fate of A Clockwork Spiral...

134184.name: Dragon Quest IV: Chapters of the Chosen (DS)
videogamehonor: 2008 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
134184.description:
User Summary

Dragon Quest IV: Chapters of the Chosen for the DS is the second remake of the original game. It was remade in 3D with a slightly altered immigrant town, enhanced upgrades, smoother graphics, and improved sound. The ability for the player to take manual control of their entire party in the final two chapters was also added.

This version of the game contains an entirely new translation of the script and uses a new spell naming convention first used in Dragon Quest VIII.

134185.name: Vampire Hunter 2: Darkstalkers' Revenge
134185.description:
User Summary

Vampire Hunter 2: Darkstalkers' Revenge is an updated version of Vampire Hunter that was released exclusively in Japan only a few months after the release of the original.

Minor tweaks and changes were made to the characters move lists and the combo system, such as the removal of air chains. The game features the same character roster and soundtrack as Vampire Hunter but removed the characters introduced in Vampire Savior. Oboro Bishamon, Marionette, and Shadow were included as secret characters.

134186.name: Vampire Savior 2: The Lord of Vampire
134186.description:
User Summary

Vampire Savior 2: The Lord of Vampire is an updated version of Vampire Savior that was released exclusively in Japan only a few months after the release of the original.

Minor tweaks and changes were made to the characters move lists and the combo system, such as the removal of air chains. The game features the same character roster and soundtrack as Vampire Savior and included Donovan, Huitzil and Pyronbut but removed Jon Talbain, Dark Talbain, Rikuo and Sasquatch. Oboro Bishamon, Marionette, and Shadow were included as secret characters.

videogame: Vampire Savior 2: The Lord of Vampire
134187.name: Vampire: Darkstalkers Collection
videogamecompilation: Vampire Savior 2: The Lord of Vampire
134187.description:
Vampire: Darkstalkers Collection a compilation of all five Darkstalkers arcade games that were released in Japan only. The compilation features the original arcade versions of the games, as well as hidden arranged versions of the three Vampire Savior games, which introduce an alternative version of Donovan, Dee, as a secret character with his own storyline.

Source: Wikipedia, "Vampire: Darkstalkers Collection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134188.name: Darkstalkers Resurrection
134188.description:
Darkstalkers Resurrection is a compilation of Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revenge and Darkstalkers 3. The updated features include HD visuals, online multiplayer, replay sharing, spectator mode, and in-game unlockables.

Source: Wikipedia, "Darkstalkers Resurrection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134189.description:
The Familiarisation Area is a small promo for Zooloretto that allows a place for players to place an obtained animal that doesn't fit legally into their zoo.

When taking a delivery truck, if there is no legal place for an animal in a player's zoo, he may place the animal into his familiarisation area. The area may only hold one animal.

Players may also transfer an animal in or out of the area via the move or exchange remodel actions.

At the end of the game, no points are scored or lost for an animal in the familiarisation area.

Also available as part of the Zooloretto: Goodie-Box.
134189.name: Zooloretto: Familiarisation Area

134190.name: Rapid Response
134190.description:
From the publisher's press release:

Rapid Response is the fast-paced, question and answer game that pits your basic knowledge up against a twisted timer! Families and friends will have a blast trying to multitask as the questions fly, the balls drop and the bell dings. Don’t get distracted by the “DING!” – as time quickly runs out! Quickly give your partner clues to guess the category on the card: “Cake…Ice Cream, Candles…Streamers“ Your partner shouts “Birthday Parties!” Right! Now grab a marble from the bottom trough and put it back into the funnel at the top of the slide to buy yourself more time.
The object of the game is to quickly (and correctly) guess the phrases being described by your partner before all the marbles run down. Open-ended categories make it easy for all ages to get into the action – hints can be as complex or simple as you need them to be.

134191.description:
Set of the Limited Edition, 54 World Trade Card Set. This was only available through Kickstarter and brings the total number of World Trade Cards to 108.
Doubling the number of routes available makes it much harder for seasoned players to predict what routes you are trying to complete based on purchasing of an individual city.
134191.name: Expedite: Limited Edition Word Trade Card Set

134192.name: The Dungeon Alphabet: Expanded Third Printing
134192.description:
From the back cover:

THE DUNGEON ALPHABET

Expanded Third Printing

An A-to-Z reference for classic dungeon design.

Designing dungeons is as easy as A, B, C!

The Dungeon Alphabet compiles inspirational tables of classic dungeon design elements to assist the Game Master in creating subterranean challenges. This third printing adds eight new topics to the existing twenty-six for thirty-four tables of inspirational materials.

A is for Altar, B is for Books, and C is for Caves: The Dungeon Alphabet has advice, hints, and randomized tables that bring new life to your adventures.

The entries are accompanied by outstanding art from classic fantasy illustrators and are compatible with all fantasy role playing games.

admin comment
this is the expanded edition of The Dungeon Alphabet

134193.name: Rhythm Control 2
134193.description:
User Summary

Touch the onscreen pads in time to music from YMCK, 61 Degrees, Bit Shifter, and more. Each tap is graded on how well you keep in time with each track.

134194.name: Inkvaders
134194.description:
Whilst doodling away, half dazed from the boring lecture I was in, I thought I saw the image move. The Martians I was drawing were invading my notepad! I had to do something to stop them. Pen in hand, I drew a hero to fight them off. Bold, brave, no fear of death, the story unfolded before my eyes...

The Earth was in peril... again!

The task of saving the day falls at the feet of Generic Marine (G to his friends). As the Martian horde invades, G must battle his way from his base on the Moon back to Earth, to wipe the Martian menace from our streets and restore the human race. It won't be an easy task but G has an arsenal of 15 deadly weapons to hand. Join him and shoot, splat, and blast your way through 30 levels across 3 unique locations, to victory!

Source: The Developer Website.

134195.name: Beach Party Bingo
134195.description:
From the Rules:

"Beach Party Bing is a fast to learn and fun to play, and like most Coin Creature games all you need is dice and some pocket change.


* *


Object of the game - the first player to cover all 12 spots on their game card is the winner, with the losers giving the winner a Monster coin from the Coin Creature based game or a card front the expansion pack!"

Basically, this a dice version of the classic bingo game incorporated into the Coin Creature world of RAK Graphics.

134197.name: Eestlaste ümberilmareisid
134197.description: Roll the dice and move around the world with the modern estonian travelers. Who finishes first is the winner.

134198.name: 4SQR
134198.description: A tile-on-tile laying word game for 2 or more players. The board consists of seven tiles, each with a two-by-two grid of spaces. In the early turns, these are laid out and letter tiles placed on them. Once they are all out, turns consist of moving a board tile and replacing the letters. Score more for longer words and multiple words. The game can be played for a predetermined number of rounds or to a points target.

134199.name: Blast-Off
134199.description:
Space race game. Object of the game is to move 4 satellites completely around the orbit in a clockwise direction and into their correct position in "Final stage" marked by corresponding colour.

Movement of satellites is by the roll of the dice with a 1 or 6 to start a satellite from inside its rocket to the blast off position to begin the orbit . The satellite then moves around the orbit by exact number of spaces indicated by the dice. If a player lands on his opponents satellite, he knocks his opponents satellite out of orbit sending it back to the start. Satellites may land on hazards which sends them back to their original position in the rocket.

The satellites are coloured marbles

Copyright 1958 by Quality - Craft Products

Distributed by Raoul Inmports Inc. Dallas Texas

134200.name: A Trip to the Moon
134200.description:
Early space exploration to the moon

A simple roll and move game based very much on the Jules Verne From the Earth to the Moon novel. The instructions descibe some men forming the Cannon Club to fire a missile (air coach) with them inside it to the moon.

Player use a spinner to advance to the moon and back

Unknown German publisher and year. Maybe early 20th century

134201.name: Journey to the Moon
134201.description:
Space exploration game from earth to the moon, where the object is to navigate 2 rocket ships from earth to the moon which keeps circling the earth. Three artificial satellites also circle the earth and rocket ships land on each of the moving bases before reaching their objective. First to reach both ships on the moon is the winner.

Moon and satellites are flat coloured disks. Rocket ships and similar to wooden golf tees.

Devised by B. and A. Reid

Published by Geographia probably late 1950s

134202.name: Colonel Jet Space Game
134202.description:
Simple spin and move game that advances through space. For two players, th objective is to see which Colonel Jet can get his armada of 3 space ships to the top of the world.

Interestingly, the playing pieces also can be worn as lapels with pins for hats, button holes, shirts etc. The tin spinner (windsock indicator) is secured into the board.

Produced by Silver Rich Corp. 32-36 Greenpoint Av, Long Island, N.Y. Dated 1952.

134203.name: Don Future Rocketeer
134203.description:
Space adventure, real estate game where players travel around the solar system to control planets, moons and rocket companies. The objective is to have the most property and money at the end of the game.

Large monopoly style space game board where each player moves his rocket ship around the outside of the board buying up planets or rocket stations. He then builds rocket fields on his planets and returns to earth to collect more money from the space bank. The game has a three dimensional feel with planets and moons as solid coloured balls on the central area of the playing board. Rocket fields are smaller orange balls place atop of the planets by coloured sticks. Space-o-gram cards are similar to chance cards in monopoly.

134204.name: Rocket Patrol
134204.description:
Tactical space war game similar to the boardgame Battleship where two players each with sets of grids (strato-maps) place their space ships upon the grid. Oposing players then give corodinates on the Strato-maps to locate and destroy their enemies spaceships.

The inside of the lid is used by one player while the inside box by the other. Colorful 1950s graphics.

134205.description:
From Sirlin Games website:

Five copies of each of three new chips, to expand Puzzle Strike's gameplay.

Combinatorics assists your rushdown.
Dashing Strike helps you control your pile size while filling your opponent's gem pile.
Custom Combo is an explosion of 15 actions, enabling insane combos!
134205.name: Puzzle Strike Promo Chips

134206.name: Book of the Entourage
134206.description:
From the back cover:

Don't Leave Home Without Them

As the holder of a manor, each vassal knight in King Arthur Pendragon heads a a small feudal society that revolves entirely around him. This is the knight’s household. He doesn't have equal time to do everything or see everyone, and so his household does many tasks for him. His personal social sphere forms layers around him.

Always at the center is the knight. Nearest to him are his key supporters: his squire, probably a wife, and perhaps one other closest advisor. The knight's retinue is next. The retinue is divided between the famuli, which assists the knight at home and manages the manor when the knight is away, and the entourage, which leaves the manor when the lord travels.

Book of the Entourage features information about the squire and wife at the center of the knight's entourage, including both a Random Squire Table and a Random Wife Table. Dozens of professionals and servants available for hire are also detailed.

Lady characters are not overlooked. There is a Random Husband Table and information about maid-in-waiting and professionals more suited to the Lady's needs.

Book of the Entourage is the perfect sourcebook for the player who wishes to fully detail and realize the accoutrements of nobility.

134207.name: Heroes of the Sea (CoC)
134207.description:
Publisher Blurp:

Zero Point Part 2

Wartime roleplaying…
…with tentacles!

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a wartime CALL OF CTHULHU roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazis, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary war machines, and enough writhing tentacles to fill ten Reichstags!

Heroes of the Sea is the second standalone adventure supplement in the globe-spanning Zero Point campaign. Play soldiers, agents, and resistance fighters in the chaos and carnage of the Battle of Dunkirk, as a sinister conspiracy threatens the lives of the retreating Allied forces!

Inside you will find everything you need:


A standalone 63 PAGE multi-episode adventure for several sessions of play!
New rules for wartime investigations, including tanks and Stukas!
Maps of Europe and the evacuation at Dunkirk
An “Operational Briefing” and many other beautiful handouts!
Four pre-generated characters to get you playing immediately!


Requires a copy of the CALL OF CTHULHU 6th Edition rules to play.

134208.name: Amethyst: Evolution
134208.description:
From publisher blurb:

THIS IS NOT FANTASY

WELCOME TO THE REAL WORLD

The machines have gotten larger. The spells have gotten more powerful. Magic and technology continue their conflict, despite looming threats to both sides. The future may rest not with fanatics, but with those searching for way to balance these two worlds.

This sourcebook offers opportunities for characters both within the Amethyst setting and outside of it in homebrew games.

THIS SOURCEBOOK INCLUDES:

Three new races along with revised originals.
Fourteen new lifepaths
The new vanguard class
New powers and class features for all original Amethyst classes
Eight new "essential" classes-presented with simplified abilities and fixed level features
Over thirty new paragon paths, both in traditional and "essential" form
Over a hundred new feats
Twelve epic destinies
New equipment from aircraft, mecha, to nuclear weapons

134209.name: Tell Me a Story: Animal Village
134209.description:
Join the animals in this village as they dance, sing, and play. Recurring characters, locations and props encourage linking the cards in endless combinations for fresh, new stories every time it’s played.

Variations for gameplay exist, but the basic elements that apply to all are: players are dealt an opening hand of cards. Cards consist of characters, objects, locations. Gameplay consists of some combination of trade/discard/draw from deck in order to complete one's collection with the required elements for the story. The first player to complete his or her story hand of cards, then "tell" the story - wins!

134210.name: Naval Battle Group
134210.description:
Naval Battle Group is a modern naval wargame designed to be played with naval miniatures.
Game scale (both time and distance) is variable, and is determined prior to play, while time scale can be changed based on circumstances.
Its rules tell how individual ships and aircraft move, detect enemy contacts, and attack them. Weapons inflict realistic effects, and proper naval tactics produce accurate and believable results.
Game-play is with dice, and no game boards are used - a protractor and tape-measure are used to measure distances and angles. A calculator is useful for determining distances based on the scale used.
Included are statistics for real-world surface, subsurface, and air units, allowing for any number of historical or what-if scenarios.

134211.name: Strike Legion
134211.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strike Legion is a science fiction roleplaying game set in the future where the mighty Imperium fights the Star Republic for domination of the universe. The Imperium is a xenophobic star empire that encompasses millions of worlds of uncountable subjugated humans. The Star Republic is a union of different sentient species that fight for their right to peace and progress. The Imperium swarms its enemies with endless hordes of ships while the Republic is defended by the Fleet with its small fleets of powerful and advanced battleships. The Imperium seems unstoppable as each new wave of Imperial ships depletes Fleet resources to the breaking point. In comes the Strike Legion. Each Legionnaire is equal to an army of regular soldiers and it is their job to enter Imperial space and destroy the Imperial war machine from within. They can do what an entire fleet of ships could never accomplish. To win the war, the Legion will have to prevail but the Imperium creates new ways to defeat them.

Play the role of a Legionnaire. (A superhuman fighting machine designed to be perfect.)
Fight the Imperium that wants to destroy everything that you believe in and love.
Win at all costs.
If you lose, all is lost.

134212.name: Tell Me a Story: Fairytale Mix-ups
134212.description:
Lizzy Rockwell’s charming fairy tale characters, locations, and iconic objects can be arranged and rearranged to create logical and/or hilarious tales. Kids will build critical thinking skills when they devise a way to incorporate a fire-breathing dragon and a flask of magic potion into their tale of a clever boot-wearing cat.

The deck of cards consist of cards of 3 categories: characters, settings, and objects. Instructions with the game offer a variety of gameplay options. One of these is that the players start with exactly 4 cards in their hand. In turn, they choose from the face-down stack. Keep one and discard one they do not want... play continues until someone has 2 characters, a setting and an object. This player is "winner" and for reward gets to tell a story using the cards in hand.

Object: Be the first with the correct combination of cards in hand.

134214.name: Tell Me a Story: Circus Adventures
134214.description:
Brandon Reese’s circus animals inspire action-packed stories of adventure and mishap. Stilt-walking cats might find mischief despite the ringmaster’s best intentions. Will all be put right by the time of the Big Top performance? Only the storyteller knows…

Variations for gameplay exist. The essentials for winning are: build a hand that includes the elements needed for a complete story and then be the first to tell (or present) the completed story.

Deal a starting hand to each player, then trade/discard/draw until a completed story is in hand. First player to place a complete story down and "tell" the story wins!

134215.name: Tell Me a Story: Mystery In the Forest
134215.description:
Melissa Sweet has painted scenes and characters full of intrigue and suspense. Storytellers will find plenty of images to develop a mystery and solve it, too. Will they connect the squirrel eavesdropping on chipmunks with the squirrel hiding golden coins under his acorns? Which happened first? Recurring characters, locations and props encourage linking the cards in endless combinations for fresh, new stories every time it’s played.

There are variations involved in this card deck game. In each variant, however, the players must use a certain number and combination of cards to create a story. Gameplay proceeds a bit differently in each case, but one must build a hand with the appropriate card types and then be the first to create a story with them. The winner is the first to reach that goal.

134216.name: Tell Me a Story: Robot's Mission
134216.description:
Robot characters in a Robot World engineered by Saxton Freymann line up to assemble a science fiction fantasy. Pick some automated animals and a space-aged skyline to start a futuristic story.

The included deck of 36 cards is dealt to the players so that each has six cards. Keep them or trade up to 2 from the remaining deck pile. The winner is first to tell a story with the cards in his or her hand.

134217.name: Orc Whacker
134217.description:
User Summary

Orcs and humans pop up out of the nine holes. Hit the orcs with your mallet and avoid hitting the humans. Score points for each orc you hit. If you hit a human you lose points, and if you hit three you lose. You have thirty seconds to score as many points as you can.

134218.name: Fairytale Spinner Game
134218.description:
Spin for a Hero, or something to ride,
A Rival, a Treasure (to find or to hide)

Choose a cave, or a castle with fortified towers
A friend and an object with magical powers

The object of the game is:
Get all of the elements first and you’ll get the glory,
Of winning (the hero, a ride, a rival and a treasure)

Then the winner has the privilege of using them all in a story!

Players spin to select the elements for their fairy tale. When they have collected a scene, a hero, a magical helper, a rival, a magical object, transportation, and a treasure, they tell the tale that these elements evoke. Game extensions encourage compassion in suggesting using a misunderstood rival as a hero on occasion, and longer tales for two players.

134219.name: Squish 'Em v1.0
134219.description:
User Summary

Stress trogs are on the attack. Smash them with your mallet or they will give you a stress meltdown. Keep the stress togs from reaching the meltdown level for a full minute to win.

134220.name: King of 20
134220.description:
King of 20 is a new competitive board game that is simple yet challenging. It can be played by anyone who understands basic math operations.

In King of 20 players use number and operation tiles to form expressions which are placed on the game board. The goal of the game is to receive the lowest score possible by making expressions that are as close to the number 20 as possible. A player's score is determined by comparing the solution of their expression to the number 20. For example: an expression with a solution of 18 would have a score of 2. Players must use tiles already on the board and those in their hand to form or add to expressions.

Although King of 20 is an effective educational tool, players of all ages and skill-sets can enjoy it. Young children and adults alike will love the games competitiveness, simple gameplay and sleek design.

Ishmael King created King of 20 in March of 2011 when he was a freshman in high school. He noticed that subjects such as English and History were regularly adapted into board game forms, while the subject of Math was poorly represented in the industry. The few math board games that existed were too simple or too complicated to play, or were made for an age range that was too specific. So he took the opportunity to make a game himself.

134221.name: Tales of the Space Princess
134221.description:
From the publisher:

Take your dungeon crawls into the future! Tales of the Space Princess is a rules lite game inspired by the original fantasy rules. Character creation in about 5 minutes, learn the rules in about 10 minutes and then you're ready to delve into the space fortress to wrest the Space Princess from the clutches of the Dark Lord!

134222.description:
Platoon Leader 3.0 CG rules for ASLComp with color cover and CEMETERY HILL campaign game and overlays.

Platoon Leader 3.0 is a system for playing tactical-level battles using a series of Scenarios referred to as a "campaign game" or CG. This campaign game lets players recreate, in detail, the fighting of various great battles. Players take up the part of both the overall commanders, choosing which units will reinforce the initial troops, as well as the local commanders, fighting it out for each objective of the campaign. Players use a 'purchase' method to select troops for the first Scenario for the campaign. They set up their troops, determine who will attack and defend in that action then play that Scenario.
