The end of the Scenario brings the players to the Reorganization Phase, where they resolve the location of the front lines, determine the fate of disorganized and damaged units, and then purchase new units for the next Scenario.

PL 3.0 aims to provide a concise, enjoyable campaign experience, playable by the average gamer over a couple of evenings. Critical Hit regularly releases new CG's for use with Platoon Leader. The latest version of PL is available at Critical Hit as a free download. This new version supersedes versions 1.0 and 2.0 and all errata. PL 3.0 remains compatible with all previously-released campaigns.
134222.name: Platoon Leader 3.0

134223.name: Shadow of the Haunted Keep
134223.description:
From the back cover:

On a summer eve with a near full moon, you, your friends and some family have gathered in a sacred forest grove to celebrate the coming harvest. Enjoying song, stories and dance, you are suddenly rudely interrupted. Guttural voices, shouts and screams. A horde of wolves pours out from between the trees. On their backs are gruesome little men, armed with spears and jagged swords.

134224.name: Twisted Eyes
134224.description:
A party game in which players have to draw while wearing glasses that distort what they see.

The game is played in teams. The goal is to be the first team to reach the finish space on the board. The board shows a track consisting of green, yellow and blue spaces. The active team rolls a colour die and moves their pawn to the next space of the corresponding colours. A member of that team inserts the glasses of the same colour (different amounts of distortion) and rolls the die again to select which of the three words from the card he/she has to draw. He/she then tries to draw, wearing the glasses, so that his/her teammates manage to guess the word within the amount of time specified by the timer. If the team is successful, they roll the die again and move their pawn to the next space of that colour. If the time runs out before they have guessed correctly, the team's pawn stays where it is.
The team who reaches the finish space first wins the game

134225.description:
Players have four pegs in your base and you need get them to HOME. HOME is only place (and base) where your safe from other players from landing on your peg and knocking you back to base. To move; players pop the middle dome and move the number indicated on the die.

The game supports four players. Players can choose to be (the male characters from series) Red Ranger, Blue Ranger, Green Ranger or Gold Ranger. Players need to pop a 6 in order to move one of their four pegs from base to start and they get another turn. Players get another turn whenever a 6 is popped.

Players will spend about 15mins playing and having fun getting your Power Ranger pegs into HOME (safety from other players) and knocking other player's Power Ranger pegs back to their base!

Objective of the game: Be the first player to get all four of your Power Ranger pegs into HOME.

Seems like a themed version of Trouble
134225.name: Power Rangers Samurai Pop 'N' Race

134226.description:
You go around the city several times with your pawn to get Aliens tokens which score most points of influence, so you can become the Master of Kuriosït.

Each player will have to move cunningly his pawn around the edge of the board to get Aliens tokens scoring most points, without neglecting the others, that can be used to make some special moves (see in front page, the special actions).

On every turn, the players will necessarily have to move their pawns from at least one space to be able to get an Alien token. If you think it is not interesting to take the token, you don’t have to. Because every time a token is taken, another one is going to move on to its space and if this last one is very interesting it is the player behind who may get it.
134226.name: Kuriosït

134227.description:
Find the most matching pairs to win! The Power Rangers are scattered around as you try to find matching pairs to collect.

On your turn pick any two cards. If they are the same, you get to keep them. Find a pair of the special Take Red Ranger cards and you get to take the Red Ranger figure. Be the one who has it at the end of the game and you'll get bonus points.

Game objective: Be the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
134227.name: Power Rangers Super Samurai Make A Match Memory Game

134228.name: Kapsle
134228.description:
A flicking game similar to PitchCar but with plastic components.

Plastic caps are flicked along a track composed of plastic pieces. Two flicks are allowed per turn. If your cap leaves the track, it is put back in its previous position. The first player to complete the course three times wins the game.

Several variants are described in the rules. The number of flicks allowed can be changed as well as the number of rounds, bonus points can be assigned for being the first to reach certain points on the track etc.

The pieces can be put together differently to allow for differently-shaped tracks.

134229.name: Wizard's Tournament for Kids
134229.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once a year, wizards from all over the realm come together to fight for the title of Archmage. The winner of this tournament is crowned the most powerful sorcerer in the entire world and becomes the head of the Council of High Mages. Wizard’s Tournament for Kids is a fantasy deck building game of magic combat where players fight to defeat each other using spells, monsters, and relics. The game comes with thirty three different sets of cards composed of six copies of that specific card.

During play, each player starts the game with nine copies of the Spirit card, which is his starting deck. Cards are purchased from the twelve active stacks of cards and placed in a player’s discard pile. Once a player’s deck runs out of cards, the player shuffles his discard pile together to make a new deck. The changing sets of cards means that every time you play Wizard’s Tournament for Kids, it is a brand new but balanced game. Spells cards allow a player to manipulate, heal, and damage monsters, your opponent, and yourself. Monsters are brutal attackers and valiant defenders that you can summon to your side during a battle to protect you from rampaging monsters and attack your opponent. Relics are ancient artifacts that give a player a special power that can be used each turn. Each player starts with thirty Life and if you reduce your opponent’s Life to zero, you win the game.

This Deck Building Game Includes:

12 Monster Cards
15 Spell Cards
6 Relic Cards
Spirit Cards

134230.name: Ping, Pang, Pong!
134230.description:
A simple dice game for children that incorporates drawing using a drawing template, and a rock-paper-scissors element.

In the basic variant, the active player rolls the five colour dice up to three times per turn. The highest number of identical colours is the number of spaces he/she may paint or cross out on the penguin's racing track on a sheet of the notepad. To make this easier, there is a drawing template that covers all five possible cases (1-5 spaces). The first player to have covered the complete track wins the game.

In the advanced variant, an ice pyramid has to be covered instead of a straight track. In addition, all players roll at least one die, even if it is not their turn: each player gets one die, the active player the remaining dice. The active player can try to win matching dice from other players by winning a rock-paper-scissors duel (which is re-themed as ice floe, water and rock). The first player to have covered his/her pyramid wins the game.

The drawing template also includes a penguin shape that the children can draw on their sheet and add further details, like hats or clothes as a drawing activity.

134231.description:
Exodus: General is an expansion which requires the base game Exodus: Proxima Centauri. The main component of the Generals expansion is the pack of 14 unique Ability cards, which add a special, once-per-game, special ability to each faction, adding an unknown factor to the game.

These abilities are designed to influence the normal course of the game while still preserving the balance.

The extra Centaurian Resistance cards are also part of the Generals expansion and they should be used together with the base game resistance cards. They provide more challenging Centaurian opponents and offer more important rewards.
134231.name: Exodus: Generals

134232.description:
The Supplies bonus card is an extra Bonus Action and it was designed to be used together with the base game, Exodus: Proxima Centauri.

The Supplies bonus action allows every player to receive a planetary or ship upgrade of his choice, provided that he has already researched that specific technology.

Note that, as is, this card is not compatible with the 2nd Edition of the base game (it is larger than the other cards and the art is also different)
134232.name: Exodus: Supplies bonus card

134233.name: Die Lieben Sieben: Auf dem Jahrmarkt
134233.description:
The game board is a sliding lane with six fields, each showing a fun fair attraction. At the end of the field, there are three wooden "tin cans" stacked up.
The active player draws a card and tries to slide the marble slider onto the corresponding field. If successful, s/he gets the card. For two of the same cards, the player gets a free ride chip. If the player flips up the tin can card, s/he has to try to topple the three tin cans to get a free ride; if unsuccessful, the other players can try (in clockwise order).
At the end of the game, the player with most chips is the winner.

134234.description:
The Golden Age is an expansion which requires the Wild Fun West base game. It is made of 30 Event cards and 1 Event info card which describes the rules of the expansion.

Every event card is written in the memory of an important event of the Old American West period between 1840 and 1890 and the effects on each card reflect in some way the historical significance of that event.

Although not a game changer, the Event cards bring another layer of planning and fun to Wild Fun West.
134234.name: Wild Fun West: Golden Age

134235.description: The Rustles is a promo card for Wild Fun West and requires the base game. It features a special ability, every time it is used to steal money it must be passed on to the next player, thus more people will have the chance of using its unique ability.
134235.name: Wild Fun West: Rustler promo card

134236.description:
The Chieftain is a promo card for Wild Fun West and it requires the base game.
The Chieftain has a special ability allowing its owner to collect extra income if no building has been built during the current turn.
134236.name: Wild Fun West: Chieftain promo card

134237.name: Anomalous Subsurface Environment: Dungeon Levels 2 & 3
134237.description:
From the front cover:

The Anomalous Subsurface Environment is more than just robots and lasers -- its clowns and dinosaurs, too! Levels 2 and 3 of the critically ignored gonzo megadungeon are finally available -- with more classes, more tables, and more cruel and unusual ways to die deep beneath the surface of the post-apocalyptic Earth!

134239.name: Float (Browser)
134239.description:
User Summary

Move your ball in and out of the water collecting stars and avoiding the bombs. Three play modes. Arcade where you can get invincibility power ups and lock the screen to grab stars, countdown mode with no bombs where you grab as many stars as you can in time limit and sprint mode where there are 100 stars on the screen from the beginning and you try to grab them all in as little time as possible.

134240.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 146 - Mar/Apr 2011)
rpgissuearticle: "Das Raulsche Reich ist nicht Spielzeug eines Kriegstreibers!"
Horte magischen Wissens - die zweite Magierakademien-Spielhilfe
Kartenglück und Schicksalszeichen - Geheimnisse von Inrah und Boltan
Von Wergeld und Fragstatt - Gerichtsverfahren in Aventurien, Teil 1
134240.description:
Issue 146 of the periodical Aventurischer Bote, the in- and outgame journal for "Das Schwarze Auge".

The outer part contains outgame information and is separately numbered from the inner part, which contains ingame articles.

134241.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 141 - May/Jun 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Heilige Herde folgt der Hüterin der Kelche
Magische Forschung in Aventurien - Ein Überblick
Stahl aus Ymras Seiten: Waffen der Dunklen Zeiten
Unterwegs in Aventurien und darüber hinaus
134241.description:
Issue 141 of the periodical Aventurischer Bote, the in- and outgame magazine for "Das Schwarze Auge".

The outer part contains outgame information and is separately numbered from the inner part, which contains ingame articles.

134242.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 140 - Feb/Mar 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Ein Lied vom hohen Herrn Hagrobald
Zunge des Lichts für immer verstummt!
134242.description: Issue 140 of the periodical Aventurischer Bote, the in- and outgame magazine for "Das Schwarze Auge".

134244.name: Destination Moon
134244.description:
Simple roll and move game to the moon and back, with the objective to be first back

Graphics similar to Dan Dare type rockets and space vehicles and probably dated around mid 1950s

Published by Holdson products, New Zealand

134245.name: Durance Surveyor Cards
134245.description:
From the Durance Kickstarter page:

This high quality deck of cards includes all of the colonies and planets, as well as the planet/colony survey assessments, putting everything you need in easy reach. The deck is a set of poker-sized, full-color cards with rounded corners and a glossy finish, making it an attractive addition to your tabletop game.

User summary:

These cards were available as a backer reward for the Durance Kickstarter campaign. All of the survey information from the book is reproduced on these cards, along with additional guest-authored supplemental surveys (which do not appear in the book). The survey process in the game can be accomplished using the survey sheets and what's in the book or using the cards.

134246.name: rotaZion
134246.description:
User Summary

Maneuver a rotating bar through a field of mines. Collect additional bubbles to score additional points. Power ups are also available that can clear the screen of mines, gain large point scores or get a shield that makes you invulnerable.

134248.name: Clubby The Seal
134248.description:
User Summary

Clubby the seal is seeking revenge on hunters and beasts. Hit enemies with your club and sell their hides on the black market.

134249.name: ThunderStrike 2
134249.description:
User Description

ThunderStrike 2 is the sequel to the Sega CD original, AH-3 Thunderstrike. The player controls an assault helicopter (a modified AH-64 Apache) and performs secret missions all across the globe. Action is conducted from a first-person perspective. There is some mission variety in that there are multiple theaters of war and there are different enemy troop types and objectives in each mission.

134250.name: Star Wars: Force Commander
134250.description:
User Summary

Star Wars: Force Commander is a 3-D real time strategy game based loosely on events found in the original movie "Star Wars" series. Players control a variety of units ranging from ground troops and vehicles to turrets and structures.
The game is scenario driven, with options to play skirmish actions as either Rebel or Imperial forces.
This is game was developed for Windows 95/98.

134251.name: Evilgeddon Spooky Max
134251.description:
User Summary

Creatures from the netherworld have taken over and you are the first to fight back. Gain upgrades such as speed, additional money, increased armor, additional hit points. Default weapon is a handgun. Pick up weapon drops flame throwers, sniper rifles and shotguns. Each weapon can also be upgraded in several categories. Upgrades are maintained throughout the game.

134252.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jenga Tatooine Battle Game
134252.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Take turns bombarding the porky kingpin in the sandblasted terrain of Tatoonie (back of box.) "Roll, Launch, Win"

This is a new edition to the Jenga & Angry Birds line. The game comes with a Luke Skywalker bird, a Jabba the Hutt pig, a Rancor pig, a Millennium Falcon launcher, 12 plastic Jenga blocks, 2 dice, label sheet, and game guide. The object of the game is to launch birds and knock down pigs to score the most points. One player is the builder, and the other player is the launcher. You score 1000 points for each pig you knock completely off the structure. In addition, you score a bonus 1000 points if you have any birds left unlaunched after you knock all the pigs off. Take turns until you've played three rounds. If you scored the highest, you win!

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
134253.description:
In Hostage Negotiator, you play the part of a law enforcement agent responsible for negotiating the release of hostages taken by an unscrupulous figure hell-bent on having his or her demands met.

Each turn in the game represents a conversation between you and the hostage taker. You'll play cards and roll dice to increase conversation points, decrease the threat level, and release hostages. Hostage Negotiator uses a unique "hand-building" mechanism that puts cards you purchase directly in your hand for next turn rather than leaving you wondering when the cards will show up like in deck-building games.

In Hostage Negotiator there are multiple paths to victory, but the hostage taker has other plans. Will you try to calm him and get him to surrender? Will you stall and bide your time before sending in the team for a major extraction? How many hostages will you save? These are many of the exciting decisions you will make in a game of Hostage Negotiator!
134253.name: Hostage Negotiator
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 032 - If I’m Going Down…
1P 061 - Rory’s Story Cubes
1P 089 - Sylvion
1P 094 - Hostage Negotiator & Dice City
1P 103 - Burgle Bros.
BGA Ep 83 - Top Ten Games that Bumped Other Games from Our Shelves
Episode 18 - Small Games, COIN Games, And Star Wars Rebellion Review
Episode 78-- Star Studded Origins 2014 Wrap Up
Episode 81-- Gen Con 2014 Top 11 to Try and Top 11 to Buy with special gues W. Eric Martin from BGG News
Episode 83-- Live from GEN CON Part 2-- from the show floor
Episode Charlie - 2016 Retrospective
Favorite Games of 2015
HLG 10: Meer Essen
Low Player Count - Ep 23 - Game Weight
Low Player Count - Ep. 15 - The Filler Episode
Low Player Count - Ep. 2 - I Know What You Did Last Turn
Low Player Count - Ep. 5 - geringe Anzahl Spieler and the Spiel des Jahres
Low Player Count - Ep. 9 - Digital / Analog
OBG 175: Preview Party
Review: Hostage Negotiator
The Game of Crowd Funding AJ Porfirio Interview 08-06-2014

134254.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Take turns bombarding an imperial hog in the frozen terrain of Hoth (from back of box.) "Roll, Launch, Win!"

This is a new edition to the Jenga & Angry Birds line. The game comes with a Luke Skywalker bird, 2 Snowtrooper pigs, a Snowspeeder launcher, 12 translucent plastic Jenga blocks, 2 dice, label sheet, and game guide. The object of the game is to launch birds and knock down pigs to score the most points. One player is the builder, and the other player is the launcher. You score 1000 points for each pig you knock completely off the structure. In addition, you score a bonus 1000 points if you have any birds left unlaunched after you knock all the pigs off. Take turns until you've played three rounds. If you scored the highest, you win!

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.
134254.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jenga Hoth Battle Game

134255.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jenga Death Star Game
134255.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Darth Vader and his porky enforcers are ready for an intergalactic battle. Take turns trying to topple the Empire. Pull back the X-Wing fighter to launch an epic squawk attack with Luke, Han, or Chewie birds (from the back of the box.) "Roll, Launch, Win!"

How many hits will it take the heroes to knock the pigs block off and explode the Death Star?

This is a new edition to the Jenga & Angry Birds line. The game comes with a Death Star frame, a Luke Skywalker bird, a Han Solo Bird, a Chewbacca bird, Darth Vader Pig, 4 Stormtrooper pigs, a X-Wing launcher, 31 plastic Jenga blocks, 1 lock block, 1 dice, label sheet, a game base,and game guide/setup card.

The object of the game is to destroy the Death Star. Roll the die to determine how many shots you can take & which birds to use. Alternate turns until the Death Star is destroyed.

Stormtrooper pigs = 1000 points each
Darth Vader pig = 3000 points
Complete destruction of the Death Star = 5000 points
Unlaunch birds after the Death Star is destroyed = 1000 points each.

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.

134256.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jabba's Palace Battle Game
134256.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

"Launch,Stack, Destroy!"

Princess Leia Bird, Jabba the Hutt Pig, and Jabba's Rancor Pig.

This is a new edition to the Angry Birds line. The game comes with a three figures, a launcher, 6 plastic blocks, 1 place piece, and instructions. The object of the game is to launch birds and knock down pigs.

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.

134257.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Darth Vader's Lightsaber Battle Game
134257.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

"Launch, Stack, Destroy"

Stormtrooper pig, Darth Vader pig, and Obi-Wan Kenobi Bird

This is a new edition to the Angry Birds line. The game comes with a three figures, a launcher, 6 plastic blocks, 1 Lightsaber hilt, and instructions. The object of the game is to launch birds and knock down pigs.

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.

134258.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – At-At Attack Battle Game
134258.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

"Stack, Launch, and Destroy"

Luke Skywalker Hoth Pilot Bird, At-At Commander pig, R2 D2 Egg, Rebel trooper Echo Base Gear Bird, Luke Skywalker Echo Base Gear bird, Han Solo Bird, Darth Vader pig, At-At Driver pig, 2 Snowtrooper pigs, and 2 Stormtrroper pigs.

This is a new edition to the Angry Birds line. The game comes with a 12 figures, a launcher, 8 At-At pieces, 21 blocks, and instructions. The object of the game is to launch birds and knock down pigs.

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.

134259.description: Hex Rampart is a variant of Rampart played on a hex hex board. Play starts with black. On his turn a player may either drop a stone of his color or remove a dead enemy group. Players may only legally drop stones adjacent to at least one of their stones already on the board. A group is considered dead if any stone within it has no adjacent empty cells. Removal of a group takes a whole turn. Removing own dead groups is strictly prohibited. Passing is prohibited unless a player has no legal move on his turn. The player to remove all enemy groups from the board is the winner.
134259.name: Hex Rampart

134260.name: Moria
134260.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game represents an unlicensed use of elements of the Lord of the Rings franchise.




Moria is a roguelike computer game. The original version was written at the University of Oklahoma by Robert Alan Koeneke and Jimmey Wayne Todd after they became hooked on Rogue but could not run it on the VAX-11/780 minicomputer to which they had access.

Version 1.0 was written in VMS Pascal and completed in the summer of 1983. From around 1985 the source code was widely distributed under a license that permitted sharing and modification but not commercial use. Koeneke's last release was Moria 4.7 in 1986 or 1987, although more recent versions have been compiled by a variety of authors.

Moria begins with creation of a character. The player first chooses a "race" from the following: Human, Half-Elf, Elf, Halfling, Gnome, Dwarf, Half-Orc, Half-Troll. Racial selection determines base statistics and class availability. One then selects the character's "class" from the following: Warrior, Mage, Priest, Rogue, Ranger, Paladin. Class further determines statistics, as well as the abilities acquired during gameplay. Mages, Rangers, and Rogues can learn magic; Priests and Paladins can learn prayers. Warriors possess no additional abilities.

The player begins the game with a limited number of items on a town level of six shops: a General Store, an Armory, a Weaponsmith, a Temple, an Alchemy shop, and a Magic-Users store. A staircase on this level descends into a series of randomly generated underground mazes. Deeper levels contain more powerful monsters and better treasures. Each time the player ascends or descends a staircase, a new level is created and the old one discarded; only the town persists throughout the game.

Moria inspired a number of derivative versions. Jim E. Wilson created Umoria, a modified version in C for UNIX and MS-DOS; Umoria later became Free Software under the GNU General Public License, through the work of the free-moria project. At the University of Washington a modified Pascal version named Imoria was developed, which has been ported to C by Steve Kertes.

Umoria (UNIX Moria), inspired the roguelike game Angband which influenced the preliminary design of Blizzard Entertainment's Diablo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Moria (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134261.name: TriviaNatura
134261.description:
This is a roll-and-move spanish trivia game where players must answer only environmental questions at specific spaces to get progress toward victory, like in Trivial Pursuit. Same gameplay with different and cheaper components.



Un juego español al estilo Trivial Pursuit, pero sólo con preguntas relacionadas con el medio ambiente. Misma mecánica de juego con componentes diferentes, aunque más baratos.

134263.name: The Beast of Geshtein
134263.description:
From the first page:

A small farming community is plagued by thievery and the mayor is powerless to stop them! Who or what is behind these crimes? Brave and inquisitive adventurers are needed to solve the mystery and bring peace to the people of Bemuen. An Adventure for character levels 1-4

A free adventure hosted on Dragonsfoot.

user comment
there is no date listed on the PDF

134264.name: Heroic Toolkits: Vehicles (Revised)
134264.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroic Toolkits; Vehicles, is the first in a new line of sourcebooks for the True20 game system. Each product in this series will provide Players and Narrators with exciting resources for their True20 series!

Vehicles make exciting props for a True20 story. They create instant images in the minds of players and represent mobility, travel, passion, conflict, intrigue and virtually any other emotion or concept that the Narrator wishes. When the Narrator describes the villain arriving in a pearl white Aston Martin or escaping in a sputtering Sopwith Camel World War I biplane, a scene is set in the minds of the players! Vehicles help set the scene and help create an image.

The True20 rules provide basic statistics for a few common types of vehicles. This supplement provides the Narrator with more. More vehicles, more options, more feats and more suggestions on gameplay. Spice up your True20 story with True20 vehicles—up in space, below the waves, on the freeways or the muddy dirt track roads of some medieval kingdom. More action and excitement awaits!

Vehicles is a 60 page vehicle sourcebook, providing you with a plethora of vehicles suitable for use in fantasy, golden age, modern, post modern and sci-fi genres. Optional rules are also provided, expanding on the chase rules intriduced in Technothrillers: A True20 Espionage Toolkit. Also included are new vehicle weapons and feats.

134265.name: True20 Ship Combat
134265.description:
From Introduction:

This little doc offers up a sleek and simple set of rules for running sailing ship combat using the True20 rules from Green Ronin.

134266.name: Dino-Pirates of Ninja Island
134266.description:
From publisher blurb:

The original rules to DINO-PIRATES OF NINJA ISLAND, the role-playing game of prehistoric swashbuckling kung-fu adventure!

Ninjas. Pirates. Dinosaurs. Warring island nations. Samurai riding velociraptors. Tyrannosaurs hunted by jungle tribes. Dueling factions of shadow warriors. Fallen kingdoms deep in forgotten jungles. Privateers battling the servants of the Imperial Navy.

DINO-PIRATES OF NINJA ISLAND!

The 100-page rulebook contains all the material found on the DINO-PIRATES website, including character creation, supernatural powers, creatures, ships, combat and all the other essentials of great pulp adventure. These rules are all released under the Open Gaming License, so anyone can make use of them.

The website also includes all the details on this thrilling setting, with descriptions of islands and ninja clans and pirates and terrible creatures. You can contribute to this setting, too!

134267.name: Player's Handbook 2 Power Cards: Sorcerer
134267.description:
From the back of the box

With Player's Handbook 2 Power Cards, you don't need to crack open a rulebook every time you cast a spell or swing your sword. All the crucial information is at your fingertips. Just pick out the deck for your character class, select the cards for your character's powers, and you're ready to play the Dungeons & Dragons Roleplaying Game!

Contents

100 power cards, including all Sorcerer powers found in the Player's Handbook 2 plus a few blank cards you can customize.

134268.name: Motor Team
134268.description:
A race game of motorbike that you have to ride your team to victory obtaining more points with your team.

Each player has a team of three motorbikes (Yellow, purple, red and green).
The aim of the game is to move all your team to gain the highest score by summing the result of the arrival of the 3 motorbikes.
The movement of each motorbike is done by a wheel with an arrow in the middle, at the turn player spins the arrow on the wheel, that will indicate how many squares move the 3 motorbikes.
The tactic is dodging oil spills, and take the wake of the bike in front of you.

134269.description:
Combat Commander: Battle Pack #6 – Sea Lion is the sixth themed collection of scenarios for use with the Combat Commander series of games. The theme of this Battle Pack carries forward from BP #5 and presents a what if situation of a successful invasion of Great Britain. The early and successful conclusion to the Battle of Britain allows the Luftwaffe to dominate the skies over southern England and the Channel Ports of Southampton and Portsmouth. The actions represented in the battle pack cover the period of late September thru December 1940 and showcase the initial invasion, the Axis advance towards London, its eventual capture, the early entry of the United States into the war, and finally the British counter offensive, Operation Tremor, to drive the hated enemy from its shores. CC-Sea Lion features ten new scenarios printed on card stock and ten new maps.

Players will find scenario special rules to cover such topics as:

• Airdrops (both Fallschirmjäger and supplies)
• Prison Breaks
• British Fascist uprisings
• Targeted Sniper Attacks
• Partisan attacks on German Rear Areas
• Alternative night rules for Opportunity Fire


The new maps depict specific locations in southern England, several of which the designer has personally visited. The player will get to fight over critical areas such as Portsmouth, the Medway River, Trafalgar Square and Holloway Prison in London, and the Port of Dover. Can you command the troops at your disposal to crush the British spirit and win the war for Germany or muster the remnants of the forces rescued from Dunkirk and the Home Guard to repel the invader and send him back across the Channel? Operation Sea Lion is active and commences now.
134269.name: Combat Commander: Battle Pack #6 – Sea Lion

134270.name: Avengers Initiative
134270.description:
Download the first installment of Marvel's biggest cross-over mobile gaming event. Level up, gear up, and fight as Hulk in the first adventure of an episodic series built exclusively for touch screen devices. Track down and defeat some of the world’s most notorious villains like Wendigo, Abomination, The Kronan, and The Skrulls, and help THE AVENGERS pull the world back from the brink of catastrophe. Marvel’s Avengers Initiative, an episodic mobile gaming event unlike any other.

In the wake of The Pulse, The Vault, a top secret S.H.I.E.L.D. facility in the Rocky Mountains, has busted open, releasing all of the super powered criminals and monsters imprisoned there. Aboard the S.H.I.E.L.D. Helicarrier, Nick Fury recruits a reluctant HULK to round up all the monsters he can while S.H.I.E.L.D. can assemble the rest of THE AVENGERS to figure out who opened the doors to The Vault and why.

Visceral Combat

Experience raw, SUPER-POWERED COMBAT with blazingly responsive swipe, attack, and combo controls in a complete gesture based action game.

Stunning HD Visuals

Battle huge BOSS-SIZED enemies while enjoying amazing special effects and incredible set pieces.

Unique Customization

FULLY CUSTOMIZE Hulk to play the way you want to play. Acquire exclusive costumes, unlock incredible super-powered abilities, discover explosive augmentations, and upgrade all of Hulk’s combat stats.

EPISODIC CONTENT

Marvel’s CROSS-OVER MOBILE GAMING EVENT continues with updates, scheduled events, and anticipated character reveals, setting a new standard for mobile gaming.

Source: The Developer Website.

134273.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spirit Storm is a game supplement that adds twelve new cards to Wizard’s Tournament for Kids. These cards will greatly increase the playability of the game and the possible combinations that can be played each game.

This Card Booster Includes:

6 Monster Cards
3 Spell Cards
3 Relic Cards
134273.name: Wizard's Tournament for Kids: Spirit Storm

134274.description: [d0x3d!] is a cooperative game, for 2-4 players. Players assume the role of hackers, infiltrating a network. Together, you need to collect shares of digital assets and use these to re-capture stolen digital assets. Once you get all four digital assets, you and the other players need to escape the network, without getting caught. Each round, the admins patch the network and they may detect your intrusion. If the admins begin to suspect you are in their network: machines may get decommissioned for forensic investigation, the network threat level increases, and you or your friends might get caught.
134274.name: [d0x3d!]

134275.description:
This expansion to The Duke core game, adds a little literary flair, while still maintaining the major goal of the game, which is to capture the opponent's Duke tile. It introduces four characters taken from the Robert E. Howard literary universe.

1. Conan the Barbarian
2. Kull the Conqueror
3. Dark Agnes de Chastillon
4. Soloman Kane

This expansion does make some modifications to the starting tile set, as well as providing two possible playing options for the expansion set.

When using The Duke: Robert E. Howard Expansion you replace the following tiles in the core game:

Conan = Champion
Kull = Wizard
Agnes = Ranger
Solomon Kane = Priest

The rulebook for this expansion provides two ways to incorporate these tiles into the game.

1. Utilizing a draft selection process between both players.

2. Allowing players to choose whether to accept the expansion tile in place of the corresponding core game tile when it is drawn from the bag.
134275.name: The Duke: Robert E. Howard Expansion

134276.name: The Fourth Horse
134276.description: The 4th Horse is a card game that combines the excitement of a fight to the finish with the intense strategy of chess. Two, three or four players may compete. Certain card combinations can be used to win bidding rounds or as special powers. The illustrations of cards are of a medieval style. There are 4 Horse Cards that can act as wild cards in their suits or if all 4 are played then the game can be won. Winning is also achieved by having 4 sequential royal cards of a suite and as the only player at the end of the turn to do so. Number cards can be played to attack when 4 cards in sequential order are played. Knives can remove cards of one suite from the play area, Thieves can steal all of a players cards, Swords can discard cards, Moon cards replicate other powers and also can eliminate a player. When playing cards, at least 2 cards in sequential order must be played. The challenge is deciding on whether to use the cards for their bidding value, save them to build sets or play them on the table to show people what you are collecting.

134277.description:
The Island of Catan is rich with resources and beauty. The great nations meet upon the island for a decade-long festival of culture and trade... and a grand competition. Living solely off of the land, they must build the greatest society they can in a short time. To do this, the nations decide to recreate the Wonders of the Ancient World. But only one of each Wonder can exist, and there are only so many Wonders that the land can support!

This expansion, which has been in development for over 2 years, can be combined with The Settlers of Catan base game or with many of Catan: Seafarers and Catan: Traders & Barbarians scenarios. As you upgrade your Wonders, you will gain abilities that allow you to either rake in the resources or wreck havoc on your opponents. Combine these abilities in a game that will have you revisiting Catan as if you have never really played it before!
134277.name: World Wonders (fan expansion to Catan)

134278.name: Solarian Tactics
134278.description:
User Summary

Solarian Tactics is a turn-based tactical role playing game designed for the iPhone! Engage in short yet strategic battles, add unique characters to your team, unlock impressive attacks, and enjoy a gripping story!

A team of elite soldiers have just graduated from the Solarian Academy when they find themselves on a backwater planet that turns into the center of a plot that spans the known galaxy! Can you help them discover the truth?

+ Unlock 5 distinct characters, each with their own personalities and abilities

+ Upgrade your team with 40+ Augments that pushes them to amazing new heights

+ Fight against bosses with never-before-seen abilities

+ Use intuitive touch controls that feel right - this game is made for the iPhone !

+ Follow a storyline that spans multiple planets, new technologies, and dark secrets

+ Enjoy beautiful graphics built tailored for the retina display

134279.name: Mafia Casino
134279.description:
In the card game Mafia Casino, you want to be the first player to raise $30 million, whether through legal means (such as building hotels or casino resorts to attract clients who deal in pearls and diamonds) or means that fall on the shady side of legal (such as extorting someone or planting bombs in the hotels owned by opponents). The game lasts a number of rounds, and in each round players have a choice between building, gambling, conducting "business", or completing a mission.

Game description from the publisher:

Enter a world where money and the mafia go hand in hand. Build your Casino-Hotel and aim to become the richest. Attract prestigious guests, deal pearls and diamonds, and partake in games of chance. Spying, bombings, robbing safes, and embezzlement will help you sabotage the plans of your opponents. Be cautious though, there are no such things as “rules” in the Mafia.

134280.name: Random Esoteric Creature Generator (Original Edition)
134280.description:
publisher blurb

The Random Esoteric Creature Generator for Classic Fantasy Role-Playing Games and Their Modern Simulacra allows a referee to create a fully-statted monster quickly and easily, providing their game with an unlimited supply of fresh and never-before-seen challenges. In addition to the generator itself, the book also features advice for the referee as well as strong editorial content.

user comment
Goodman Games published a different edition of this book Random Esoteric Creature Generator (Goodman Games Edition)

134281.name: Karvisen ÄTSH-peli
134281.description:
In this Garfield game all players have four pawns they must move around the board from their own start space to their own goal. Each side of the square shaped game board holds start and goal of one player colour. You throw one die on your turn and move that many spaces on the board. If you land on a space already occupied by another player's pawn, you get to bump that pawn back to start. If you land in a space where there is a picture of Garfield's paw, then you are safe and no pawns can be bumped back to start from those spaces.

First player to move all pawns of her colour to the goal wins the game.

134282.name: Dungeon Realms
134282.description:
Dungeon Realms is nothing that is a card game for 2 players using deck-building mechanics in conjunction with the placement of workers, among others.

In Dungeon Realms, you play the role of an adventurer, inexperienced and novice of his hometown, eager challenges and adventures. Gradually, as the protagonist of the story, you have to explore (and plunder) with courage and bravery the region, facing many dangers and unimaginable adventures, thus gaining experience, reputation and social status and progress level.

Revive with courage, vigor and courage all the excitement of the adventures of an adventurer, palace intrigue and danger firsthand, and first-person protagonist of the adventures of an adventurer, bizarre, drunken and quarrelsome, in an exciting fantasy medieval district where they meet and are home to a multitude of stories, legends and fantastic tales.

Defy fate reaching for his sword, looking great treasures, and thieves' loot evil creatures, make the most powerful collection of magic items, descended into hell, look ultratumbas in ancient underground cities, check city distant dwarf king Aquilón , conspires palace, enjoyed in the company of your own Stag Tavern in between quarrels, hookahs and spicy wine bottles, performs missions for the king or for the thieves guild, save princesses and kill dragons. Only fame or death awaits.

You are a adventurer who tries to gather enough money and experience to become the next champion of the mark. Of course, you depend on the work of others to get the needed experience. You start with a set of 9 cards (6 of them are money, which give you 1 gold coin each and 3 cards to get 1 experience points (PXs)). Each round you draw 5 cards from your deck and use one card for the turn order to place your workers (adventurers marks). The workers go to the different building places in the Village to buy new cards for you (go and solve adventure), get experience or different other actions. Each turn there is one more space, where you can place your workers.

Also there is a Line of Events with 6 cards (quest and events representing), which you can choose to buy and each round the empty places in this row are filled from a deck of cards divided into 3 different "Ages" (the last two ages cost more gold coins).

The game ends in different ways: when a player reaches 100 px, or one player kills two dragons, or when no cards sufficient to fill the Line of Events.

134283.description:
[From the publisher's website]

1914, Serbien muß sterbien, The Initial Campaigns on the Balkan Front in WWI realistically covers the battles fought in and around Serbia during the first year of World War One.

1914, Serbien muß sterbien (an Austro-Hungarian jingle that translates to “Serbia must die”) is a comprehensively researched model that explores the intriguing set of campaigns fought in Serbia in 1914. The game includes an accurate order of battle and detailed game map. The map encompasses the primary theater of war from Peterwardein in the north, Sarajevo in the west, to Niš in the south-east.

The game system used is the same as found in 1914: Offensive à outrance (GMT). The game has a playtested, concise, well written and organized 24-page rules booklet.
1914, Serbien muß sterbien includes three sceanrios. Two short scenarios and a Grand Campaign scenario that covers the period from the initial Austro-Hungarian invasion in August to exhaustion a stalemate in December.

The game-design goal for 1914, Serbien muß sterbien is to produce an enjoyable game from which players can learn a great deal about the campaign and the geography of the theater of war. The result is a game that the "WW1 enthusiast" must have and that a gaming connoisseur will enjoy.

Game Scale:
The combat units are primarily Divisions and Brigades. The map’s scale is 1:500,000. Each hex is approximately 8 kilometers across, with the corresponding area being roughly 6475 hectares (or 16000 acres). Each game turn represents from two to four days of time depending on the season.
134283.name: 1914: Serbien Muss Sterbien

134284.name: Cracked's Game of Millionaire
134284.description:
It’s like Monopoly: Roll and move. Land on an unowned property: buy it. Land on an owned property: pay money to the owner.

It’s different from Monopoly: Only one die is used. The board is rectangular, with 10 spaces between the corners on the long edges and 6 spaces between the corners on the short edges.

It’s much less than Monopoly: No color groupings, therefore no monopolies. No house/hotel improvements. No utilities. No railroads. No auctions. No mortgages.

Victory conditions: Players are eliminated when they go bankrupt. The last player with money is the winner.

134285.name: Smurfspelet
134285.description: Players are Smurfs and race through the forest. First Smurf to reach the goal wins. Movement is controlled by a die. One side of the die has a picture of a raspberry glass. If you roll the glass, you collect one raspberry juice token from a face down pile. The token shows either a full glass or an empty glass. If you land on a special space on the game board, you will count your full juice glasses and advance that many steps. If you land on a space with Gargamel, you lose a turn.

134286.name: atWar
134286.description:
atWar, formerly Afterwind, a free online multi-player turn-based strategy war game - in the traditions of Risk and Axis & Allies - is now available to play in BETA. 

Some features of atWar are:

Free troop movement, no 'grid' or predetermined paths, allowing for complex battle sequences.
Realistic World default map based on real world populations and GDP to determine reinforcements and income from cities.
City populations suffer from collateral damage when attacked, affecting reinforcements and income.
Play against up to 20 people simultaneously.
Make your own maps and units to provide for endless entertainment and possibilities.
Free to play, also available via Facebook.




In the pursuit of creating an engaging turn-based strategy game a realistic world map was taken and the 'grid' system and pre-determined paths that dictated troop movement were eliminated. Now units can move anywhere in the map based on their individual range (although land units can not go on water and vice versa). There are over 10 main land, naval and air units available with many more 'rare' units that are sometimes found when capturing a city. Having this new free movement induces complex battle sequences and demands a high level of strategy acumen.

Another method to enrich the gaming experience is the use of real cities within real Countries and Provinces, rather than just regions. Cities are based on current Population and GDP statistics to determine Reinforcements and Income players receive. Furthermore city populations suffer under attacks affecting the Reinforcements and Income of the city.

A feature sure to bring a lot of interest is the Map Editor, where players can make their own maps and units paving the way for one to Re-enact any battle in the Past, Present or even Future. There are already hundreds of maps available that were created by members, including maps based on the Game of Thrones, Lord of the Rings, Ancient Greece and Futuristic battles for Galaxies.

The game has also been kept straight-forward, with most of the inner complexity in the background, so new players shouldn't be intimidated. The interface and controls are simple and intuitive, and there's no annoying micromanagement. Most of the game revolves around expanding your territory, using different units at the player's disposal. Each game can have up to 20 players spread around the entire map. To reward the players, we have Medals (achievements) and Strategy Points, which can be used to unlock various upgrades, and also translate into ranks. Of course, the best reward is still winning a fair game against worthy opponents.

Source: The Game Website.

more than Risk online

134287.name: Mazes & Perils
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Free Game - Gold Winner
134287.description:
Publisher's blurb:
Grab your sword, buckle up your armor and memorize your healing spells, because its time to play Mazes & Perils Core Rules. M&P is a not a “clone”, but more of a fantasy rpg game inspired by the rules put together by the late Dr. John Eric Holmes in the late ’70s of a very popular roleplaying game. This book also provides a look of where it could have gone if allowed, giving you even more levels, going to level 12. So sit back, relax and grab your dice as you will be playing old school rules, Mazes & Perils!

From the Introduction:
MAZES & PERILS is a game of role playing in a fantasy world, suitable for ages 10 and up. To play, you need only this rulebook, some dice, paper, pencils, a few friends, and your imagination.

If you have played other fantasy role playing games, the MAZES & PERILS rules may feel familiar to you. Inspired by the 1977 “Holmes” version of the world’s most popular role playing game, MAZES & PERILS goes beyond the introduction provided by the Holmes version, allowing for longer-term campaigns. Even if you don’t need another standalone fantasy role playing game, you may find a few useful new ideas herein that you can use with your other games.

134288.name: Turno
134288.description:
Turno consists of a hexagonal board divided into 96 triangles, with two players arranging thirty pieces (four cannons, eight bowmen, and three knights each) on their starting positions as marked on the board. Each piece has a red side and a gold side; players pick a color prior to starting and place their pieces with their chosen color facing up.

Players take turns moving. Pieces may be moved to unoccupied adjoining triangles (triangles that share a side, not a point.) After having moved, if an adjoining triangle is occupied with an opponent's piece, a player may announce an attack, which will result in a capture or a kill of that piece. Captured pieces are turned over to match the attacking player's color, killed pieces are removed from the board, never to return. (A captured piece may not be attacked for one turn.) The outcomes of attacks are determined as such:

Kill
knight kills knight
bowman kills bowman
cannon kills cannon

Capture
knight captures bowman
bowman captures cannon
cannon captures knight

Players may prevent attack by moving a piece in danger to a triangle immediately next to a potential attacker. (Pieces must move before attacking.) The winning player captures or kills all of the opponent's pieces. One optional advanced rule is included, allowing knights to move through the small hexagons that cover the points of all the board's triangles.

134289.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Valentine is a legend among the spies of the Empire. Throughout the entire network of agents, she is the only one who has never failed a mission in anyway. An expert at infiltrating enemy lines and using Lost Logias in combat, Valentine provides exemplary support for the child Empress.

Dark Empire Prowler — Lv. 40
At 5 | Dm 4 | Df 8 | Ar 2 | LP 12 | Re 9 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Innate Abilities: Ranged Attack (16 In.), Infiltration
Information: At the beginning of the game you can force an enemy unit to reveal its Advantage Cards.
Surprise Shot: The turn Valentine comes out from Infiltration her Ranged Attacks cannot be intercepted.
oo — Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
Valentine becomes Hidden. Upkeep: o
o — In My Sights (Subterfuge, Effect, Reactive)
Activate this ability during the Upkeep Phase and choose an enemy unit to which Valentine has Line of Sight. Until end of turn, if said unit declares any type of Movement, Valentine can make a free Ranged Attack against it before it moves.
ooo — Perfect Shot (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Ranged (12 In.) +5 Attack / -2 Armor. If the target is less than 4 inches away from Valentine, this attack obtains an additional +4 damage. This attack can only be used if Valentine is Hidden.
ooo — Execution (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Ranged (16 In.). Throw two dice and keep the highest roll. If this attack deals damage, it causes Slow Lv 3. Effect 16.
134289.name: Anima Tactics: Valentine

134290.name: 007: The World is Not Enough (GBC)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134290.description:
User Summary

A third person version of James Bond's adventure based on the movie of the same name.

134291.name: 10 Pin Bowling
134291.description:
User Summary

A basic bowling game for one or two players. Very few options are available, the only bowling is a standard game (no tournament mode or anything else).

134292.name: Action Man: Search for Base X
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134292.description:
The game's plot centers around the protagonist Alex "Action" Mann, and his mission to stop the evil Dr. X from releasing a weapon of mass destruction. Action Man must find Dr. X's base by playing through levels in various locales.[1] The player is given a variety of suits for Action Man to wear in different situations, including a parka, a wet suit, and a space suit. Each level can be completed multiple times in order to achieve different goals; the correct suit and items are not required on the first completion of a level, but later attempts require specific suits and items to bypass obstacles. By wearing different suits and using specified items, alternate paths in levels can be discovered.

The gameplay is similar to other 16-bit era action video games. The game contains fifteen missions for the player to complete spread through six main areas. The player is allowed to choose two weapons to bring into battle with them, such as a crossbow and a pistol. The game allows the player to jump, run, swim, and climb through various areas of the game, allowing for a more varied experience.

Source: Wikipedia, "Action Man: Search for Base X", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134293.name: Disney's Alice in Wonderland
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134293.description:
User Summary

A sidescrolling platformer based on Disney's animated movie, Alice in Wonderland. Follow the white rabbit down the rabbit hole for more than 20 levels to play through. Save up to three game files with the battery backup.

134294.name: Animorphs
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134294.description:
User Summary

An adventure with RPG battles that is base don the book series of the same name. A group of kids is given the ability to morph into animals by an alien, as long as they are willing to save the earth from a set of bad aliens. Use your morphing abilities to combat enemies and solve puzzles.

134295.name: Antz
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134295.description:
User Summary

A platforming game base don the movie of the same name. Jump on enemies to defeat them while collecting hearts to heal, coins for more lives, and keys for extra continues.

134296.name: Antz Racing
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134296.description:
Antz Racing is a kart racing game developed by RFX Interactive and published by Electronic Arts for the Game Boy Color in 2001. The gameplay is similar to Mario Kart. The game has 3 racing modes, Quick Race, 4 Seasons, and Head to Head.

Source: Wikipedia, "Antz Racing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134297.name: Armada F/X Racers
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134297.description:
User Summary

A racing game set in the future. Choose a driver from several different alien races to race against the others. Power-ups are available to help you blast the competition, including bosses that must be defeated. A campaign mode lets you play through the story while mission mode lets you replay single races that you have already gone through.

134298.name: Armorines: Project S.W.A.R.M. (GBC)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134298.description:
A group of marines fitted with advanced suits of armor protect Earth from an invasion of alien spider-like beings.

The Game Boy color version, developed by Neon Studios (NEON Software GmbH), is a top-down 2D shooter.

Source: Wikipedia, "Armorines: Project SWARM", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134299.name: Army Men
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134299.description:
The first game of the series. It was originally released for PC, then was later ported to Game Boy Color. Regarded as a classic by fans, this is one of the few games to actually display Sarge and his squad as merely pawns in a bigger battle. Two features that make this game almost unique in the series are its storytelling (Black and white spoofs of World War II-style newsreels), and the fact that it often depicts fighting that doesn't involve the main characters. Many fans of the series as well as reviewers rate this game the highest.

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134300.name: Army Men 2
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134300.description:
This game is a direct sequel to the first game. The enemies in this game are diverse, ranging from suicide bombers, to zombies, cult members or cockroaches. There is also a wide range of battlefields, such as a kitchen in the "Big World", or a tank factory in the "Plastic World".

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134301.name: Arthur's Absolutely Fun Day!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134301.description:
The game is based on the children's television series Arthur. Players guide Arthur aardvark around a map of Elwood City, playing ten different minigames. Each completed minigame awards Arthur a gold star, collecting 16 stars earns Arthur a free pass to enter the amusement park WonderWorld and play a further five different minigames. Players can replay all minigames once access to the theme park has been earned.

Source: Wikipedia, "Arthur's Absolutely Fun Day", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134302.name: Austin Powers: Welcome To My Underground Lair!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134302.description:
Austin Powers: Welcome to My Underground Lair! is a video game released for the Game Boy Color. It is a simulation of a computer of Dr. Evil, the antagonist of the Austin Powers movie series. There are a few mini-games included, such as Mojo Maze, a Pac-Man clone, Domination (an Austin Powers-themed version of Reversi), a digitalized version of Rock-Paper-Scissors, and 'Kin'-Evil, which is a motor bike racing game whose name is a play on Evel Knievel. It features customizable backgrounds, themes, sounds and screen savers, a movie clip, along with a calculator and simulated Internet with information on the Austin Powers films and the actors.

Source: Wikipedia, "Austin Powers: Welcome to My Underground Lair!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134303.name: Austin Powers: Oh, Behave!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
134303.description:
User Summary

An "Austin-themed" version of the game Austin Powers: Welcome To My Underground Lair! It includes several minigames, sound and video clips from the movie, screensavers, and more.

134305.name: Basketball Bones
134305.description:
Game clock winding down, tie game, road team brings the ball up the court with the home crowd shrieking "DEE-FENSE, DEE-FENSE!" as the visitors try to get the rock in the hands of their top scorer for a possible game-winning shot. But pro basketball is a player's game, and sometimes the play that the coach designs doesn't work, so here comes a 20-foot jumper from the least likely shooter on the court as the clock is about to reach triple zeroes. The shot is true, tickling the net as the home crowd groans!

Is this a scene from any given night in the pro game? Absolutely – and it's also a scene that can happen with the same frequency when you play Basketball Bones, PT Games' new tabletop simulation of pro basketball using four dice ("bones") and player cards for a remarkably compact, efficient game engine in which very few charts are consulted and almost every possession is resolved by the dice and cards. Rebounding beasts, three point specialists, needle-threading passers and ham-handed, foul-prone defenders are all here, ready to perform for you on your tabletop as if it was made of hardwood. From the league's MVP to the 12th man on the worst team in the league, Basketball Bones rates every pro player in shooting percentage, field goal attempt frequency, rebounding, passing and more. The Rare Play charts introduce intangibles such as momentum swings, injuries, boneheaded decisions, and more!

134306.name: My Kingdom for the Princess
134306.description:
One day Princess Helen traveled across the lands to visit her uncle King Sigmund. The king was eating and waxing nostalgic, when all of a sudden... A tornado came and wrecked havoc on the lands. Animals, houses, and even people flew through the air. King Sigmund's castle somehow withstood the storm. But his troubles had only just begun.. The tornado woke Firemouth the dragon, who, according to legend, could not sleep until he ate 37 people. The legend might be wrong, but the dragon had already eaten eight people, and didn't seem the least bit ready to go back to sleep.

And what's more, Princess Helen found out that during the tornado, her father, King Olgert, had been struck by lightning. Nobody knew whether he would live or die. She needed to return home immediately but all the roads were in ruins, the hamlets were destroyed, and a hungry dragon circled over the land.

Arthur, a knight famed for his wit and courage, answered duty's call. Not only would he have to escort the princess, but he would also have to restore the ruined lands. King Sigmund promised him a shiny new castle as a reward for successfully completing the quest.

But everyone knows that good knights don't care about rewards. They are only concerned with heroic deeds and love.

Source: The Publisher Website.

134307.name: My Kingdom for the Princess II
134307.description:
Game My Kingdom for the Princess II, screenshots, description, reviews, commentsGame My Kingdom for the Princess II, screenshots, description, reviews, commentsGame My Kingdom for the Princess II, screenshots, description, reviews, comments
Download My Kingdom for the Princess II

The adventures of Arthur and Princess Helen continue in this long awaited sequel to the addictive strategy, time management, simulation game. Adversity strikes and once again it’s up to Arthur to clear the land, defend against invaders, and work with magical beings like flying cats and witches as he chases after Longbeard the Dwarf, who has kidnaped Princess Helen.

Long-awaited sequel to the award-winning title My Kingdom For The Princess.

Unique game play (mix of strategy, time management and simulation), now with new mini-games.

Great and intrigue story

Expand your castle and earn trophies.

Amazing graphics.

Original musical compositions.

Source: The Publisher Website.

134308.name: Krono: Shattered Ages
134308.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Krono is a free, digital Collectible Card Game (digital CCG) from Large Animal Games, designed to settle the age-old question: Which were the greatest warriors in history?

In the distant future, time has started to unravel. Temporal Rifts have begun to appear, creating destructive links to the past and plunging the world into near-apocalyptic ruin. A few survivors, known only as Traversers, are able to harness the power of these Rifts.

In Krono, you play the role of a Traverser, travelling between the Rifts to assemble an army that lays claim to the greatest soldiers of the past, present, and future. Choose from samurai warriors, Viking berserkers, knights of Camelot, Aztec warriors, and more. Using this force, you will battle for survival and supremacy in this shattered future.

Directed at strategy card game players, Krono is an innovative combination of classic CCG action and deck-building games. Combine unit and command cards from your custom decks to compete for control of three different zones. Capture two zones and you win the game. The premise is simple, but the gameplay is deeply strategic.

Planned for iOS, Android and the web in 2013, Krono emerged from one of Large Animal's Sandbox Days, where our staff are free to experiment with new game ideas. The game proved so popular internally that we decided to share Krono with the world.

134309.name: Parageology
134309.description:
From the publisher website:

Awakened Lands
When you’re a shadowrunner, you look for every ally you can get, any advantage you can grab. Which means that if the ground beneath your feet can either help you or hurt the other guy, you’re going to find a way to make that happen.
The earth is full of magic. Mana lines wriggle and writhe in different locales, and strange elements bubble up from the core of the planet. Some areas boost magic to seemingly impossible heights, while others drain it away, sucking mana into nothingness. There are powers out there, just waiting for you to call on—powers that may also be waiting to swallow you whole.
Parageology is an essential guide to the magical powers that imbue the ground of the Sixth World. From the location and effects of mana lines across the globe to the powers of strange minerals unearthed since the Awakening, Parageology provides resources, plot hooks, and game rules to fuel adventures and campaigns tapping into the magic springing up from the earth.
Parageology is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

134310.name: Dream Powers
134310.description:
From publisher blurb:

"To sleep, perchance to dream..." Dreams have been omens and harbingers throughout history and power over dreams means near-omnipotence in that misty nighttime world of sleep and imagination. Dream Powers range from crafting cunning illusions to nightmares able to traumatize, or even kill.

134311.description:
This expansion to the The Duke core game, adds the atmosphere of the Arthurian mythology, while still maintaining the the major goal of the game, which is to capture the opponent's Duke tile. However, with this expansion the actual Duke tiles are replaced by the opposing characters of Arthur and Mordred. It introduces seven mythical figures taken from the Arthurian legends and stories, as well as a new terrain tile.

1. Arthur
2. Merlin
3. Lancelot
4. Guinevere
5. Perceval
6. Morgana
7. Mordred
8. Camelot/Fort

This expansion does make some modifications to the starting tile set, including the creation of asymmetrical opposing forces. It also provides one alternate playing scenario for the game using the expansion tiles.

When using The Duke: Arthurian Legends Expansion you replace the following tiles in the core game:

Arthur = Light Stained Duke
Merlin = Light Stained Wizard
Lancelot = Light Stained Champion
Guinevere = Light Stained Duchess
Perceval = Light Stained Assassin
Morgana = Dark Stained Duke
Mordred = Dark Stained Duchess

The rulebook for this expansion provides one alternate playing scenario to incorporate these tiles and the Camelot tile into the game. This alternate playing scenario gives the player special advantages whenever their Arthurian tiles are moved into or out of Camelot while its on the board.
134311.name: The Duke: Arthurian Legends Expansion
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

134312.name: Versunkene Schätze
134312.description:
Five treasures have sunk beneath the waves, and both players dive down from a recovery ship and try to be the first to recover three of them. Each turn, they roll the die and move exactly that many spaces if they can.

Published in Spielboexchen September 2012.

134313.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 138 - Oct/Nov 2009)
134313.description:
Issue 138 of the periodical Aventurischer Bote, the in- and outgame journal for "Das Schwarze Auge".

The outer part contains outgame information and is separately numbered from the inner part, which contains ingame articles.

134314.name: In Mines We Trust
134314.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Classic edition compatible adventure, for 4 to 6 characters of levels 1 to 2. Roger Peaks is a small quiet mountain range, with a strong dwarf population, until an accident opened an old mine which had been long forgotten. This old mine was a copper mine, which supplied the town with enough resources, it made them rich off the profits. Four days prior to the PCs coming into town, some townsfolk traveled to the mine to investigate, but never returned. Rumors spread as the townsfolk became nervous, wondering what happened to them? Did they get killed or did they find the treasures of the mine and run off with it? A strange little man, hires a brave band of adventures to check out what happened to the townsfolk and report back to him. This adventure can be put down in any ongoing campaign or starting campaign, for 4 to 6 characters of level 1-2.

134315.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 137 - Aug/Sep 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Auf dem Dach der rasenden Kutsche
Die SPIEL kommt immer so plötzlich ...
Ein Blick in die Dunklen Zeiten
Mit der Kaleschka durch die Schattenlande
Mit Hollow Earth Expedition reisen Sie in eine Welt jenseits all ihrer Vorstellungskraft
Stolz und Stärke - Mendena wird neue Hauptstadt
134315.description:
Issue 137 of the periodical Aventurischer Bote, the in- and outgame journal for "Das Schwarze Auge".

The outer part contains outgame information and is separately numbered from the inner part, which contains ingame articles.

134316.description:
This expansion to the The Duke core game, adds a little literary flair, while also changing the winning conditions of the game. It introduces seven characters taken from the Musketeers literary universe.

1. D’Artagnon
2. Aramis
3. Porthos
4. Athos
5. Richlieu
6. Rochefort
7. De Winter

This expansion does make some modifications to the starting tile set, changes the way in which new tiles are deployed while using the expansion, and the tiles that opposing sides start the game with.

When using The Duke: Musketeers Expansion you replace the following tiles in the core game:

D’Artagnon = Light Stained Duke
Aramis = Light Stained Wizard
Porthos = Light Stained Assassin
Athos = Light Stained Duchess
Richlieu = Dark Stained Duke
Rochefort = Dark Stained Wizard
De Winter = Dark Stained Duchess

The rulebook for provides the new set of winning conditions, as given below.

1. To win the musketeer player must capture Richlieu.

2. To win the Richlieu player must capture all musketeers currently on the board.
134316.name: The Duke: Musketeers Expansion

134318.name: Afterbomb Madness
134318.description:
From the back of the book (user translation):
The American Dream on its head. Real nightmare. Fulfilment of all fears of the 50-ies of XX century. Here's what happened to the United States, when the alliance of aliens and communists launched a total nuclear war and then initiated the invasion. But the destruction is like gangrene lasting for years. United States - like tissue that is desperately struggling to survive, but inexorably losing the progressive necrosis. This struggle lasted for nearly 150 years, although there are still pockets of resistance, to combat and defeat the warped by dark matter communists and fighting for living space aliens from another dimension. Gehenna is everlasting. And you have to live right now - the Earth is a nuclear testing ground, flora and fauna seem to be decoration of a horror and humanity collapsed and degenerated to the tribal times. Can you influence the fate of the USA? Let's find out...

AFTERBOMB MADNESS is a post-apocalyptic, grotesque role-playing game in which players take the role of Americans, living during World War III. The primary objective of the game is to survive the horrific realities of this ruined world. However, to do this, players - aspiring daredevils strongly determined to work - will have to look for allies, and support various communities and organizations. Passivity is like a ghastly slippery slope - leads in a straight line to the fatal fall, dehumanization and grim acceptance of the euthanasia that is applied to America by aliens and communists. So grab your dice and start the game!

From the back of the book:
Amerykański sen na opak. Istny koszmar. Ziszczenie wszystkich lęków lat 50-tych XX wieku. Oto co spotkało USA, gdy sojusz obcych i komunistów zainicjował totalny konflikt atomowy, a potem rozpoczął inwazję. Jednak zagłada jest jak ciągnąca się latami, nieuleczalna gangrena. Stany Zjednoczone przypominają tkankę, która rozpaczliwie walczy o przetrwanie, ale nieubłaganie przegrywa z postępującą martwicą. Zmagania te trwają już blisko 150 lat, jakkolwiek wciąż jeszcze istnieją ogniska oporu, odpierające ataki Skalanych ciemną materią komunistów i walczących o przestrzeń życiową istot z innego wymiaru. Gehenna ciągnie się bez końca. A tobie przyszło żyć właśnie teraz – gdy Ziemia przypomina jądrowy poligon, flora i fauna zdają się być dekoracją horroru, a ludzkość cofnęła się do czasów plemiennych. Czy jesteś w stanie to znieść? Czy zdołasz wpłynąć na los USA? Przekonajmy się…

AFTERBOMB MADNESS to postapokaliptyczna, groteskowa gra fabularna, w której gracze wcielają się w Amerykanów, żyjących w czasie III Wojny Światowej. Nadrzędnym celem rozgrywki jest przetrwanie w potwornych realiach zrujnowanego świata. Jednak aby móc tego dokonać, gracze – ambitni śmiałkowie silnie zdeterminowani by działać – będą musieli szukać sprzymierzeńców, wspierać różne społeczności i organizacje. Pasywność jest jak upiorna równia pochyła – prowadzi w prostej linii do fatalnego upadku, odczłowieczenia i ponurej akceptacji eutanazji, jaką aplikują Ameryce obcy i komuniści. Chwyć więc kostuchy w garść i rozpocznij rozgrywkę, by zwyciężać!

134319.name: Ring of the Baron
134319.description:
From publisher blurb:

A first edition compatible adventure, for 4 to 6 characters of levels 2 to 3. BAGLAND KEEP, once a the keep of a local lord, is now crumbled and in ruins. The keep has gone through many changes over years, and at one point was rumored to be the "Secret hide out" of the Strike Back Bandits. These bandits stole a family’s treasure. Among this treasure was Baron Verhaps diamond signet ring, a family heirloom, passed down from generation to generation. This ring means everything to Verhaps and now he wants it back. He is willing to pay a band of brave adventurers to venture into the keep and find out if the rumors are true and if the treasures are still there.

134320.description:
This expansion to the The Duke core game, adds a little literary flair, while also changing the winning conditions of the game. However, with this expansion the actual Duke tiles are replaced by the opposing characters of Robin Hood and Prince John. It introduces seven characters taken from the Robin Hood literary universe.

1. Robin Hood
2. Little John
3. Maid Marion
4. Friar Tuck
5. Prince John
6. Sheriff
7. Sir Guy

This expansion does make some modifications to the starting tile set, including the creation of asymmetrical opposing forces. It also provides one alternate playing scenario for the game using the expansion tiles.

When using The Duke: Robin Hood Expansion you replace the following tiles in the core game:

Robin Hood = Light Stained Duke
Little John = Light Stained Assassin
Maid Marion = Light Stained Ranger
Friar Tuck = Light Stained Pikeman
Prince John = Dark Stained Duke
Sheriff = Dark Stained Champion
Sir Guy = Dark Stained Duchess

The rulebook for this expansion provides one alternate playing scenario to incorporate these tiles into the game. This alternate playing scenario changes the winning conditions of the game.

1. To win the Prince John player must capture Robin Hood.

2. To win the Robin Hood player must capture Prince John, The Sheriff, and Sir Guy, assuming all of them are in play. Otherwise the Robin Hood player must capture any and all of those that are in play, which may end up only being starting tile of Prince John.
134320.name: The Duke: Robin Hood Expansion

134321.description:
This promotional item for the The Duke core game, adds a little visual humor and a new playing piece, while still maintaining the the major goal of the game, which is to capture the opponent's Duke tile. It introduces one new tile to the game with no additional or special rules.

The humorous aspect to this tile is that depending on the side its flipped to, it resembles a happy face or a frowning face.

This promotional release was exclusive to those who supported the Kickstarter campaign in 2012.
134321.name: The Duke: Jester Promo Tile

134322.description:
This promotional item for the The Duke core game, adds a a new playing piece that acts as a moving terrain piece with special abilities, while still maintaining the the major goal of the game, which is to capture the opponent's Duke tile. It introduces one new tile tile to the game with additional or special rules.

The special rules for this terrain piece allow it to capture playing pieces from either opponent.

This promotional release was given to those who supported the Kickstarter campaign in 2012, and will possibly be available later at special events held by or attended by the company.
134322.name: The Duke: Specter Promo Tile

134323.description:
As the name suggests, Archipelago: Solo Expansion allows a single player to play the Archipelago base game by competing against the game system.

Archipelago: Solo Expansion includes 27 scenarios with different conditions and objectives and with you, the solo player, taking the part of characters such as Christopher Columbus, Robinson Crusoe, and the pirate Bluebeard.
